As the werefrog drags you into her mouth, she quickly spits you back out into the palm of her hand. She smiled and let out a ribbit as her throat expanded. "I know you," she says in a surprisingly high pitched voice you'd never expect from a frog. "You're that cutie human who works as a lifeguard." "Uh, that's me. I kinda got stuck back there. Thanks for your help Ms..." The frog girl uses her long tongue to lick the side of her hair before answering you. "I'm Rebecca. I've always had a thing for human men. They're total bombshells."

You're now afraid. As the frog giantess is rubbing her huge stomach, she was smiling at you the way April usually does. "I remember one spring break where I managed to fit an ocean liner full of human hotties in my tunnel of love, if you know what I mean." Says Rebecca as she winks at you. "Now, I don't want anyone getting ideas."

"Roxy!" you yell out. Unfortunately Roxy isn't in range and Rebecca shove you...
11411112112.title: Horny Toad... er Frog

1141111212121.content:
As Lila continues her walk towards her destination you begin to fear that someone is going to tell her about your predicament, and you’re not sure how she will react, you don’t even know what her stance on humans is in terms of food. She may not be able to stand the sight of human blood but that doesn’t mean she wont swallow you whole. You get an image of the vampire tossing you into her mouth and swallowing you down and begin to shudder.

“Hello Stella, how are you doing?” you hear Lila say from above you. “Oh no” you think to yourself. If Stella sees me I’m done for. You being to struggle in an attempt to free yourself once again. “Hi Lila” Stella says in a far less enthusiastic manner “What are you up to”. “Not much, just surfing.” Lila responds, “Steven was out with me but I lost him going over a wave. Maybe you should go look for him“. Stella responds by laughing in her face. “Are you serious? Steven’s . . .”
1141111212121.title: Angry Fairy

11411112121211.content: Stella indicates your position by pointing at Lila’s crotch. “He’s right there. Dirty little human probably wanted to take advantage of you.” Lila looks down in horror and sees you pressed onto her pussy. “What the hell are you doing!” she yells as she pulls you out of the material “Please Lila it was an accident” you respond as she brings yu close to her face. “Ya right if it was an accident why didn’t you tell me? Why did you hide there like a perv?” you are quiet as you realize how much sense her argument made. You suddenly feel rapid movement as Lila cocks her hand back and throws you. Where do you land?
11411112121211.title: Exposed

1141112.content:
You end up plummeting off of the board and start heading for the water. You panic, hoping that Lila will see you aren't on the board anymore and catch you. But she's still focused on the wave. You shut your eyes and wait for the impact.

You do land, but not on water. You instead hit something solid. Opening your eyes, you're surprised to see that the water has suddenly frozen over. You landed on a patch of soft ice. Thanking you luck that you didn't turn into a stain, you slowly stand up, amazed at how you didn't break anyhting. You see that the wave has frozen too, and Lila is staring at it, confused. You turn and see a bizarre sight.

In front of you was a 900 foot tall person in a bulky, black mechanical suit with transparent tubes, which had a light-blue liquid. You look up further and see a glass dome helmet, allowing you to see who save you properly. It was a female werewolf with brown eyes. She didn't have any fur or hair, exposing her light blue skin. Looking behind her, you see a path of solid ice leading back to shore. You were truly baffled.

The strange werewolf picked you up. You shivered in her hand. "Are you alright?" She asked, sounding like she was speaking through a phone.
"Yeah, I'm fine." You say. "Who are you? I don't think I've seen you on the beach before."

"My name is Andrea Kennick." She replies. "This is the first time I've been to the beach. I saw you fall off her board and ran over to save you. Guess my condition is good for something."

Lila got off her board and looked at Andrea, confused. "Wait, we're a ways away from shore. How did you see Stephen, AND get over here so fast? And how did you freeze the water? And what condition? And-"

"STOP!" Andrea yelled. Lila promptly shut her mouth. "First, werewolves have keen senses and are pretty fast. As for the other two... You ever heard of that comic character Mr. Freeze. Well, I have a genetic mutation that's like that. My body is such that I cannot leave a sub-zero environment or I'll die. That's why I wear this suit. The coolant running through this suit keeps my body below zero. And it made so anything I touch freezes solid. And no I don't know how."

You were confused. You never heard of something like this. "Wait, if you can't survive out of sub-zero, why are you at a beach?"

"I may not be able to feel the sun without dying, but that doesn't mean I can't see the ocean." Andrea replies.

"Right. Anyway we should get back to shore. Roxy and Fran are going to want to know what happened." You say.

"I'll take you." Lila says.

"Actually, do you mind if I take him?" Andrea asks.

Who do you go with.
1141112.title: A Chilly Introduction

11411122.content:
"Sure, go ahead." Lily says as she starts walking back on Andrea's ice path. However, she had no traction on it, so she was slipping the whole way. Andrea puts you on her shoulder and starts back too.

"Hey, um, you said you had a genetic mutation. What exactly is it?" You decide to ask.

"Doctors think are not exactly sure." Andrea replied. "My body temperature is far lower that it should be. Last I checked, my body temp was -50 degrees. If I go in a location above 0 degrees, my body goes into heat shock. I only have a couple of minutes to get to a sub-zero environment before I die of heat stroke. However, I have a coolant delivery system implanted in my body. It keeps coolant circulating in me even without my suit. It only lasts a few hours, though, so I still need my suit."

"Ouch." You reply. "I'm sorry."

"Yeah. When I go out, I need every piece of my suit. If even one part is missing, I'm doomed. And I need to replace the coolant containers every few days. As for freezing what I touch, they don't have a clue. The suit keeps that in check."

"Sounds like you have a hard life."

Andrea stays silent for a moment. "I do. I have very few friends, because who wants to hang out with a freak like me? People often call me "Ms. Freeze". I hate that name. The friends I do have are understanding. I can't have pets or else they freeze, and I've only ever had one lover. You can guess what happened."

Eventually, you reach shore. Roxy and Fran are waiting there, wanting to know what happened. You explain everything to them. That seems to satisfy them, and they walk off. When they do, you ask Andrea the time. She tells you.

"Oh, my shifts up." You say.

"Really?" Andrea replies. "If that's so, I can show you my apartment. I live alone."

Do you accept the offer?
11411122.title: A Cold Walk Back

choices: That blow to the head is starting to affect you.
114112.content:
Its a wonderful experience surfing with Lila. You're really glad you took her up on her offer. As the two of you ride the wave, you decide to try and get a better view. However as you try to reposition yourself in Lila's bikini, it messes up her concentration. The movement coming from between her breasts causes her to look down. "Stephen, try to stay still. I need to focus." she tells you. Unfortunately, thats all it took to make her lose her balance.

She begins to wobble, and then she finally goes over. The board shoots out from underneath her and you fly out of her top. The both of you go under the water and are thrown about by the waves. You feel your head and then your face collide with something hard, presumably the surfboard. When you're finally done being tossed around you end up underwater. You swim towards the surface as fast as you can, realizing that you're in deeper water now.

Thankfully you make it out before you suffocate. When you surface you look around for Lila, but then hear a scream. You look over to see her staring at you fear. Its then that you notice your nose is bleeding, no doubt from when your face hit the board. "Lila, can you help me out here?"you ask, but when you move towards her she backs away. She won't come near you because of the blood. This isn't good. You're bleeding in the middle of monster waters and the only one here is too scared help. And to make matters worse......
114112.title: Wipeout!

1141122.title: Does Lila over come her fear to save you?

choices: Try to head back to shore.
Dive into the water to escape.
1142.content: As you look around, you suddenly see a surfer approaching you. Your heart sinks when you notice that it's the goth naga Connie. "Hello there Stephen. What brings you out into the water?" she asks as friendly as possible but just the sight of her approaching has you on edge.
1142.title: Connie

choices: You try to get the help of local authorities
You reach the beach and a monster snatches you up
There's something in the water, and it's big...
115.content:
You turned around and paled at the sight before you. A massive wave that was comparable to a tsunami was charging at you faster than you could even react. In a matter of seconds, your world had transformed into a fury of blue water and crashing limbs. Your vision went dark for a moment, then your lungs took in a gasp of sudden air, and it was all over. You splash towards the surface of the water, the wave having taken you down a few meters. Thank goodness you were still alive!

You looked around, a beach nearby, but it appeared...different. You could make out shapes in the distance of giants, but they didn't appear to be the monsters you were used to. As you swam closer, you could make out the difference. The city skyline was totally different than Terrordale, and you could make some female monsters in lifeguard uniforms that you knew for sure didn't work on your beach. That wave had taken you to an entirely different strand of coast!

As you looked about, you finally noticed a sign that read "WELCOME TO HORRORVILLE BEACH-WATCH WHERE YOU STEP, THE CRABS BITE"

Great.You were in Horrorville now, a city entirely unfamiliar to you.
115.title: Upon Horrorville Shores

1151.content:
You figure that your best bet is to scope around and see if you can get help from the local lifeguards. You run forward down the beach, past a sunbathing frankenstein girl and then have to roll out of the way as a large minotaur woman is about to sit on you. You gasp and pant heavily before you start to look around. There has got to be somebody around here who could help you.

You look to see that there are exactly three lifeguards on duty, all of them female. First of them was a big red sphinx girl with blonde hair. She was huge and obese and like all sphinxes, she walked on all fours. The sphinx woman was flying overhead as she looked around.

The second lifeguard was a blue skinned behemoth girl. She was a monster resembling a hippopotamus with skin as thick as a dinosaur. She was even larger body mass wise than Roxy and had an unusual hair style that was half red on one side and half blonde on the other. The behemoth woman looked up and smiled at the sphinx flying around. "Come down for air once and a while Kylie," says the behemoth girl. "I can take over patrol for you." The sphinx flies down and then licks her paw. "I'd like that very much Dominique," she says to the big behemoth girl. "But one question, where's Elaine?"

You turn and see the third lifeguard coming out. She was a yellow skinned wereseal resembling an elephant seal. She also had silver hair worn in a bob cut and snorted as she dripped seawater and snot from her nose. "No damage here girls." She said. Kylie lets out a sigh. "Elaine. Wipe your nose please." Elaine blushes and then rubs her nose before the three lifeguards walk off in different directions.

Now's your chance. Maybe one of them can take you back to Terrordale. But then again, these are Horrorville monsters. Which one do you approach?
1151.title: Local Lifeguards

1153.content:
As you swim closer, you feel waves whipping at you. You try to swim closer to shore because there was a monster in the water and it was close. From the looks of it it had to be five hundred feet tall at least. Just when you swim close to the sands of Horrorville, the monster surfaces. It is a girl monster, apple figured in shape and with bright blue skin and long blonde hair. She had scales on her belly and a fish's tail, but she had hooves for feet and the face of a horse. You've heard of this time of monster. It was a kelpie.

The kelpie flips her hair and takes a deep breath as she switches from gills to lungs and walks forward. Then you realize something. This kelpie, you never met her, but you've heard of her from Roxy. Roxy told you that her name was Aqua and she lived in the same apartment complex as her little sister Petra. You had never met Petra either, but Roxy told you if you got into trouble in Horrorville, it would be the best idea to find her. Fortunately Aqua lived on the same floor as Petra. This was some good luck.

But then you remember Roxy also telling you that Petra's apartment was extremely dangerous to humans for two reasons. Petra's landlady was a mummy by the name of Nefernina and from what Roxy said she was the worst person she'd ever met. The woman was a total control freak and hated humans with a passion. Almost every one of the tenants hate her guts (or would if they hadn't been cut out and placed in jars). Roxy even told you that they should've nailed that bitch's sarcophagus shut.

But that wasn't the only danger. There was a werewolf named Lupa that patrolled the halls. Lupa was nothing like April, the one werewolf you knew, the only werewolf you knew was friendly towards humans. Lupa loved humans, but unlike April, she loves them as food. Roxy told you that Lupa was so gluttonous she'd make it a priority to devour every human she sees. And since she could get you on land too, that made her worse than Paisley.

Then you remember that that apartment is filled with monsters from Horrorville. You had just washed up from Terrordale. You don't know why, but Terrordale and Horrorville have had a vicious rivalry since the twin cities were first formed and monsters from either side hated each other with a passion. If the monsters in that apartment found out you were from Terrordale, they might tear you apart. And from the sound of it, the monsters in that apartment included a gorgon, a manticore, a yeti, a thunderbird, a banshee and a fire genie among others. None of those sounded like the kind of monster you'd want pissed off at you.

Even Aqua was a possible hazard. You heard kelpies were predators to humans and Roxy said she didn't know whether or not Aqua was a maneater. What do you do now?

(Note: This time use the monsters that aren't part machine)
1153.title: The Kelpie (Crossover Alert)

11532.content:
You figured that Aqua didn't need to know what was going on. So as the titanic kelpie steps forward and lets out a sigh, you make a run for it to avoid getting stepped on. You run up towards her beach towel and duck into a pocket on her titanic flower printed jacket. Aqua takes her towel and dries herself off as she takes a deep breath and closes her gills. "That's enough ocean for one day," she said. "Back to the apartment." You duck deeper into Aqua's pocket as she puts on her jacket and takes her surfboard and begins to walk back towards Horroville, towards Monster Arms.

You shiver at the thought, you were in Horrorville and headed towards an apartment complex housing at least twenty monsters. Monsters that might not take kindly to seeing a human lifeguard from Terrordale, their hated rival city. You wonder if you'll even be able to reach Petra without getting torn to bits. Come to think about it, you had never even met Petra before. You had no idea what she looked like because Roxy didn't show you a picture of her yet. Well given that she was Roxy's sister, she was obviously a gargoyle so that gave you a clue and from what Roxy said, Petra was the only gargoyle in Monster Arms. Logically if you find a gargoyle, you'll find Petra.

Forty five minutes later you hear a door turning and you peak out to see Aqua has reached the apartment complex known as Monster Arms. You gulp. You were about to venture into the hornet's nest. You don't know the monsters in this building, for all you knew, this could be a house of monsters as mean as Stella or even Hannah.

Aqua walks into the building and you look around to see some of the walls were beginning to decay and the wallpaper was coming loose. You shake your head. This Nefernina woman sure did a shoddy job keeping this place together. Then you hear stomping a see a monster come from the mailroom and hide back into Aqua's pocket. The monster was a crimson skinned manticore woman with purplish hair. She was very obese, looked even moreso that Roxy and was wearing a black shirt and blue jeans as she was carrying a newspaper upstairs. The manticore also coughed slightly and held onto her forehead.

"Hi Astrid," says Aqua. "That flu isn't getting any better is it." Astrid just makes a sniveling noise. "No, Chel said it would take a few days to get better. How's the beach doing without me." Huh. Astrid must've been a lifeguard at the beach you washed up on. Aqua lets out a laugh. "They're missing a good lifeguard. Can't wait to have you back." "Thanks." "By the way. How'd you get the flu anyway Astrid? Isn't it a human disease. As far as I know, you don't even eat humans and you're a manticore." Astrid rolls her eyes and looks around. "I'd rather not say." She said weakly." As Astrid walks up stairs, you see her moon sized cheeks shaking along with her large scorpion's tail.

What she said was obviously a cover up for something but you didn't care as long as Aqua was walking upstairs. As soon as she reaches the top, you were going to run out and find whichever apartment Petra lived at. Roxy said Petra knew about you and you're certain she'd help you back to Terrordale without her neighbors tearing you a new hole for trespassing into Horrorville.

However, as Aqua is walking upstairs, you hear footsteps behind her. "Uh-oh." You say. The monster following Aqua was a giant gorgon girl with gray skin, black cobras for hair and a pair of yellow sunglasses to keep from petrifying anyone who looked her in the face. "Oh hi Georgia," says Aqua. "How was the art contest." Georgia's snake hair hisses loudly and you cower in Aqua's pocket. Georgia is in a bad mood.

"That white furred bag of Terrordale flea bait!" she yelled. Georgia must've been talking about Kath, a weretiger painter who visited Gravefield beach on a regular basis to get some fresh air as she worked on her masterpieces. "I stayed up all night working on an iron sculpture of Echidna herself," says Georgia as she grits her teeth. "And that bitch from Terrordale wins with a painting of a bunch of turtle skeletons! Lousy Terrordale."

"I'm sorry about that Georgia. Gotta go." "No," says Georgia. "We need to talk. Remember the five skulls I loaned you three weeks ago?" Aqua lets out a laugh as you cover your ears. "Oh yeah, thanks gorgon duddette, I was short on the rent that day. If it weren't for you, Cleofatra would've thrown me out." You actually laugh at that joke. That must've been the tenants' nickname for Nefernina. Cleofatra. That's clever.

Georgia then makes her hair hiss and shake and Aqua gets the message. "Oh. Don't worry Georgia. I ain't no deadbeat. I've got the cash." Then you realize something. You're standing in the pocket where Aqua keeps her wallet. "Crap!" you yell. Aqua's hand reaches in and you tremble and try to run. If Aqua grabs you, she'll realize you stowed away. And if Georgia finds out you're from Terrordale, even if she was normally friendly towards humans, you'd be in big trouble. But can you get out of the way as Aqua reaches for her wallet?
11532.title: Highway to the Dangerzone

115321.content:
Nope, that doesn't happen, and you know what ends up happening is the kelpie girl ends up grabbing you in the process. Aqua then felt something in her hand as if it was moving, and then when she brought it up she looks at you then. She gasped, Georgia gasped, and even you gasped as well, as she found you out when she grabbed you. "Oh god, please don't let this be happening again." you said worrying as Aqua got questionable. "What... how did you got here? Don't tell me you came from Terrordale." Aqua threatened, and Georgia's snakes start hissing off. You decide to admit the truth.

"Yes, I do come from Terrordale. But I can explain. You see, this morning I was working as a lifeguard at the beach there, I went out for a swim, and then suddenly a wave takes me to Horrorville, and I ended up in the beach there. Somehow I stow away in Aqua's pocket, in hopes of getting back to Terrordale. Look, I never came here to do any harm, I need to just get back to my job. Please don't kill me." you explained to them, hoping that your pleas are heard.

Aqua and Georgia thinks about this for a second and...
115321.title: She grabs you

choices: Switch to the POV of Roxy
Switch to the POV of another monster
1153212.content:
"You liar. Many humans from Terrordale have some sort of a story to tell that they never intend on causing any harm to anyone, and that they just want to get back, that is simple put.... the worst excuse I have ever heard in all of my life. You should be ashamed for sneaking onto my pocket and stowing away on it." Aqua shouted at you as you know what is coming as you gulp in fear, and even Georgia thinks you are lying as well. "Well that is shocking, you said you intend on no harm, and yet you just stow away in Aqua's pocket, intending on perverting on her one day, and then you had the absolute nerve to tell us a story that might have been true if it weren't for the fact that you actually live in Terrordale thanks to your looks or whatever, you just got yourself into a huge amount of trouble now Terrordale human." Georgia hissed just as her snakes suddenly starts getting aggressive on you and just as Aqua tightens her grip on you.

"Look, I never intend on causing any sort of harm at all, I just want to get back from Terrordale, and that is just freaking it. Man why don't your idiots from Horrorville understand this?" you said, stressed out of your current situation that you are in right now, and you are just hoping you can get out of it soon.

"Have you ever heard about.... THE DAY?" Aqua asked you. "No, I never did." you replied to her with complete honestly, and then Aqua decides to explain it to you. "Originally both sides of the city were together, and everything was just completely peaceful. Terrordale had a more summerly and spring fill, and we have the more winter and fall feel, and the two sides supported each other, and everything was peaceful, and then suddenly one day... a monster like us was killed by one of their kind, and then suddenly they accused us that one of their monsters were killed by one of us, and it was all true. Ever since that day we never trusted those folks, and they don't trust us, and that also applies to every human that lives here today in both cities. That is why we don't tolerate people from your city." Aqua finally explained to you just as she tightens her grip again, getting you even closer to choking.

"Well why not apologize and just let me....." you said before you decide it wouldn't be worth the effort to explain every single detail again as you know that they just wouldn't believe you anyway. "You know what.... forget it, go on ahead and kill me." you told them, knowing that it was over for you and your life. You look into Georgia's eyes, and then just like all stories with Medusa, your body turns into complete rock and you couldn't move at all, and then eventually you turn completely into stone. Aqua then crushes you and you shattered completely in bones. Well, guess all that trouble to explain to them was all for nothing, and now it has cost you your life. "Well, that is now taken care of. I apologize for this, you can go as an apology." Georgia said to her, deciding to let her go and not have to suffer anymore with the human, but the kelpie girl finds the bones in her pocket and gives it to Georgia. "Here it is now. It's enough to pay for it." Aqua told her, now paying Georgia. "Thanks. See ya." Georgia said before she goes back to her room and then Aqua goes off with her day.

Stephen is now dead sadly thanks to the two monsters. Man it looks like the cities will never be rekindling any time soon.
1153212.title: Ah forget it!!!!

115322.content:
It looked like the kelpie giantess would grab you but you manage to dodge Aqua's hand as she took her wallet and paid Georgia the five skulls she owed her. "There you are G-Girl," she says. "Thanks again. And don't beat yourself up over some stupid weretiger." Georgia let out a hiss. "Monsters from Terrordale are nothing but trouble!" "Lupa's cousin lives in Terrordale," says Aqua. "And so does Petra's older sister."

Georgia's snake hair hisses and flares up. "I pity them both." With that Georgia walks away. The hatred both Terrordale and Horrorville had for each other was all too real. If Georgia caught you and found out you were from Terrordale, you'd be in big trouble. Then you hear Aqua humming a Hawaiian tune to herself as she walks upstairs to her apartment.

You had to keep an eye out, Aqua lived on the same floor as Roxy's sister Petra and you had no idea what Petra looked like other than the fact she was a gargoyle. Well, she was the younger sister, but Roxy said that Petra was the biggest monster in the entire hotel. That manticore you saw was the same height as Roxy so that meant Petra was actually taller than her older sister, which you find bizarre but it's not exactly impossible. But how big was the gargoyle.

No, this was no time to be afraid. You had to keep an eye out. Aqua walks up the stairs just as a muscular purple Cyclops girl is jogging past her. "Hi Aqua." Says the cyclops. "Hey Irene," says Aqua. "Watch out for." Suddenly you hear a crash and cover your ears. "Ow." Says Irene nonchalantly. Obviously the cyclops fell down the stairs, but her muscular body could probably take it.

Then it hit you. You were on the top floor in an apartment building in Horrorville full of monsters that hated Terrordale (Petra excluded). You let out a sigh. "Come on, Petra, come out. This place is making me feel really uncomfortable." You really hope Roxy's sister comes home soon, she's the only way you could make it out of this hornet's nest and back to Terrordale. But wishful thinking as you were still stuck in a kelpie's pocket.
115322.title: That was Close

choices: You fall on the floor (Non Fatal)
1153221.content:
As you sit in Aqua's pocket and Aqua takes out the keys to her apartment, you hear loud stomping but it was louder than that of the average monster and you look forward and then you gasp in awe and terror as a large shadow appears over both you and Aqua. Another monster came forward. From the shape of her shadow, given the large wings, she was obviously a gargoyle. This must've been Petra, Roxy's sister.

But you couldn't believe what you see. Petra had bright orange skin and long white hair reaching down to her tail. While Roxy could best be described as a BBW, her sister wasn't fat at all and instead had a shocking hourglass figure, but what really surprised you was how tall she was. Aqua only reached up to Petra's knees. That gargoyle girl had to be 1000ft tall. Sure, she was Roxy's younger sister, but she definitely wasn't her "little" sister.

As Petra walks towards her own apartment with her mail, you rub your eyes. You had never seen a monster this big before. Thank goodness gargoyles aren't big human eaters. "Hi Petra." Says Aqua calmly. How could she not be intimidated by such a large monster. You figured that since the kelpie giantess lives next to Petra, she's probably used to her by now." Petra's tail swings in the air and you see your chance to get her attention and hopefully get out of Horrorville before the natives know you're even here.

You climb out of Aqua's pocket, as Petra's big orange tail, giving you a few of her heart shaped butt, swings in front of you. You gulp because you were gonna have to jump and you leap out of Aqua's pocket to try and grab hold of the gargoyle giantess's tail. But do you make it?
1153221.title: Roxy's "Little" Sister

12.content:
You remember that your supervisor, that troll Fran wanted you to see her in her office. You make your way to her office, which itself takes you thirty minutes as you let out a sigh. Fran was a nice troll and a fair boss to work for, but she seemed to like humans a little too much. A lot of times, she treated you more like a doll than a human being and redesigned your uniform all the time.

But Fran wasn't like what you'd expect from a troll, especially in the intelligence department. No, she was much worse. The woman was so dense, she couldn't even speak properly. How they found her trustworthy to promote to manager of Gravefield Beach is beyond you. But you just let out a sigh and hope to get this over with as you enter the human door she installed for you.

"Fran?" you ask. "Fran? You wanted to see me?" You feel earthquakes and then look up at your troll giantess employer. "Stephen early," says Fran. "Stephen good lifeguard." Fran picks you up and places you on her desk as you let out a grumble. "Fran, what happened this time? You know I can't do much without Roxy." "No mission," says Fran. "Fran make Stephen new uniform." "What's wrong with my uniform?" "Not cute enough," says Fran. "Fran has new idea. Fran have new design for lifeguard costume."

Fran reaches into her desk and you let out a groan, knowing the new uniform might very well be embarrassing or demeaning. What is the uniform Fran has in mind?

(I'll let you decide the looks since I"m too lazy)
12.title: Changing of the Guard('s) Uniform

choices: Good, and you and her get along
Okay, you don't get along very well
121.content:
(Cool new story BTW, hope to see me add onto it)

"Perfect!!!! Fran got exactly what you need for the day." Fran said as she pus out a bracelet like device and then she brings it to you. You look in confusion as it looks like a bracelet, but it has buttons and a scanner on it, and then Fran smiles. "Trust Fran... You like it, Fran's daughter Helga made it for you, it's the Uniforminator!" "What? What dies it do?" you asked. "It simple, you pick uniform option you want, and clothes will change accordingly, and also... Each uniform has different abilities depend on option you choose."

However, Roxy then gives a smirk. “You know, Stella, you’re just upset that you’re single.” Stella gives a gasp. “Excuse me!” Roxy lets out a laugh. “People aren’t as shallow as you think anymore. I’m so happy right now, even your cracks about my weight can’t faze me. Heck, if you were any funny, you wouldn’t need to laugh at your own jokes. You’re just a petty little ex-queen bee out of high school but you still haven’t grown up at all. Why else would you pick a fight with someone like me. You’re just a sad little girl.” Roxy lets out a laugh as she flies ahead, leaving Stella speechless as her jaw drops. By the time Stella realizes what happened, Roxy is farther away up ahead. “Wait!” yells Stella. “Don’t leave me! Pay attention to me! Pay attention to me!” Stella actually breaks down crying as she flies and tries to catch up with you and Roxy.

You and Roxy share a laugh at Stella’s expense. “I’m in such a good mood,” you say as you stroke Roxy’s ear. “Not even that pest Stella can ruin in.” Roxy plucks you and then kisses you, covering you in gargoyle spit. You were getting used to that feeling and starting to enjoy it. “Come on, beloved.” Says Roxy with a laugh. Roxy flies down and punches you both in. At that moment, who should come forward and greet you but...
13531112111211.title: A (Literal) Couple of Lifeguards

135311121112111.content:
It was none other than Fran who walked forward and she was desperate to see you. Chihiro is right behind her. "Stephen. Thank Heaven, Stephen alright. Fran so worried. Mesa bad chef! Fran already fired Mesa!" You shake your hands and smile. "Don't worry about me, Fran. I'm as fit as a fiddle." Roxy gives a purr. "More than fit. We're a couple now." Fran gives a look of surprise and claps as Chihiro smiles. "That's great, Roxy," says the chimeric beast. "I always knew you two would make a great couple." You and Roxy share a kiss as Chihiro and Fran smile at you. "Fran very happy. Oh, before Fran forget. Fran already hired replacement chef to take Mesa's place. Name Zoe. She former beachgoer." You give a blink. "Zoe?" you ask. "The blind landshark?" Chihiro let out a giggle. "No, silly, Zoe Orcaton. Go check her out."

You and Roxy decide to check out the beach grill and as Roxy flies forward, you see a familiar face at the grill. It was Roxy's youngest sister, Janet and she had her friend/fellow ranger, Edgar sitting on her shoulder. "Hi, Roxy," says Janet. "How have you been." Roxy hugs her sister and you look across to see Edgar. "Oh," says Edgar. "You must be Stephen. I'm Edgar." You smile and shake hands with Edgar yourself. "A pleasure to meet you. Did you finally settle on a girl." Janet gives a smirk at that but Edgar shakes his head. "What? Oh no. I'm still trying to make my decision. I'm just dating each girl one at a time and it's Janet's turn." Janet let out a laugh. "Oh," she says. "I was already in the lead. By the way, this new cook is really working out."

"Oh," says Roxy. "Is she? I'd like to see this new cook." Edgar gave a laugh. "Oh, it's hard not to see her." There was then an earthquake rumbling and you and Roxy look in surprise. Mesa's replacement was in fact a giant black and white were-orca who was completely bald and was wearing a chef's uniform. But what made her stand out was that she was even fatter than Roxy. She would weigh over 16000lbs if she was human. It was a wonder she wasn't immobile like Ambrousine as she stomped forward. "Good grief!" yells Roxy in surprise. The orca stuffed her face with a few baguettes before stopping in her tracks.

"Hi," she says. "I'm Zoe Orcaton. So nice it is to meet you. Helena told me about you two." "Helena?" asks Roxy. "You mean, Helena Kroft?" Zoe nodded her head. "I'm good friends with Helena and I'm sure that I'll be good friends with the two of you." Zoe holds out her hand and Roxy shakes it. "Now, you two look hungry. What will it be." You and Roxy look at each other and then you both nod your heads at each other and smile before deciding on a...
135311121112111.title: Mesa's Replacement

choices: You See Something On the Beach
135311121112112.content:
After punching in you and Roxy run into someone you aren't too eager to see. Standing in front of you is April Howler, the self professed love of your life. She's got a smile on her face upon seeing you, but its different from her usual one. "Hey Stephen, Roxy." she says. Her tone goes through a noticeable shift when she greets Roxy. "Hey April." you say, giving her a small wave. Roxy is about to say something but April interrupts her before she can. "You won't believe what I heard from Lila on the way here. She said the two of you were dating! Pretty crazy, huh?" the werewolf says with a small laugh. You and Roxy both look away awkwardly, causing her to smile to falter. "Listen April, I'm sorry but its true." you admit. April's smile disappears completely and Roxy tries to comfort her. "Look, it just kind of happened." she tries to explain. "I guess all the time we spent together sort of created some pent up attraction, and well, it finally came out." April isn't too accepting however, and starts to get upset. "You've known me just as long as her! Are you saying that she saves your life and your in love just like that? I would have gave you my skin in a heartbeat! Just imagine how adorable you would be if we had matching fur!" She seems on the verge of crying, but for some reason calms down. "Whatever. I know this is just a bump in the road. One day you'll realize you love me, so I'll let Roxy take care of you until then."

April turns tail and walks off in a huff. You and Roxy look at each other in confusion after that verbal assault. "Well she was always kind of off beat." you say with shrug. "Lets just hope she doesn't go insane and try to kill us." Roxy jokes. "Well I doubt she'd get too far, as tough as you are." you tell her while stroking her neck. She walks onto the beach and surveys the area, looking for anyone who decided to come out early. Of course you see April, who is busy collecting shells. She spots you and gives you a flirty wave.You wave back and hear Roxy give a sigh. Elsewhere you see Kath setting up her easel, and you spot Lila and Carmen running out to the ocean. "Everything seems okay." Roxy notes. "But it is pretty early. She takes a stroll down the sand and looks over at the empty food hut. While Mesa did almost kill you, its still a bummer that you have to wait until Fran hires another chef. "I hope we get another chef soon. I already miss Mesa's cooking." Roxy says. She winces slightly and looks at you, but you just pat her shoulder. "Don't worry about it, and I'm sure Fran will make sure to find someone who won't fry me up." you assure her. "Though I doubt it matters with my new skin." Your girlfriend smiles and rubs your head.

A little later the two of you are sitting on the beach watching the ocean. At this point its a little late in the morning and more people are beginning to show up. Roxy maintains a good watch on her surroundings to make sure everything is okay, but manages to sit back and relax as well. You're resting between her boobs when...
135311121112112.title: April

1353111211121122.content:
As the two of you sit there something catches your eye. You slide down off of her and land on your butt in the sand. Dusting yourself off you walk over to the shoreline, where something is shining in the sun. "Where are you going?" Roxy asks, sitting up to better watch you. "I think something washed up from the ocean." you call back. Upon reaching the object in question you find that its a large glass bottle lying on its side. It towers over you, the sun reflecting off of it. Inside it however, is what appears to be a large green ball of swirling energy. You stare at it for a second, wondering what it could be. The ground trembles as Roxy walks toward you. The bottle rises into the sky when she picks it up to examine it. "What do you think it is?" you call up. She bends down to grab you and puts you on her shoulder. "I don't know." she says, holding it up to the sun. "Well, might as well hold on to it."

The two of you head down the beach and eventually come across Opal's tent. "Maybe she'll know what this thing is." you suggest. Roxy walks inside and you see Opal sitting there behind her crystal ball. "Come for divining?" she asks, motioning you closer. "Hey Opal," Roxy greets her. "We actually wanted your help identifying something." The carbuncle leans forward. "Oh?" She motions for you to come forward. Roxy holds out the bottle, the green orb still swirling inside. "Thats..." Opal says. "Hold on, let me make sure." She closes her eyes and the jewel on her head glows. After a second her eyes shoot open and she recoils. "Envy!" she exclaims. You and Roxy look at her confused. She sighs and composes herself. "That is the sin of envy. The very essence, contained in a small space." she explains. "Really?" you ask as Roxy holds it up and stares at it. "Where did it come from?" Opal shakes her head. "I have no idea. I know that there are essences for the other seven sins as well, but no one really knows where they come from." she says. "Wait, seven?" Roxy asks. "Despair is also one of the deadly sins." Opal tells her. "If this thing is so important, than why was it just floating in the ocean?" you ask. Opal shrugs. "Who knows?" it could have been lost at sea for hundreds of years, or it could have been trapped in a sunken ship and recently floated to the surface. I'm not an expert. Whatever the case, just make sure you keep it safe."

Once you've found out what the bottle is the two of you exit the tent. "Should we have left it with Opal?" you ask. "Nah, I think its kinda cool. We just have to not open it." Roxy tells you. "You know, we never asked what would happen if we did." you add. Suddenly the bottle is snatched out of Roxy's hand in an instant. "Having fun you two?" the thief asks. Its Stella, seemingly over her earlier breakdown and back to normal. "I guess it makes sense, losers like you are made for each other. Birds of a feather, they say." she taunts. Roxy just sighs. "Seriously? You have nothing better to do?" she asks. Stella pouts a little. "I was just passing by, not looking for you! I have better things to do than worry about you and your tacky trinkets!" she says, casually uncorking the bottle. "Wait!" you shout, but its too late. The green orb flies out of the bottle and hovers in the air before shooting toward...
1353111211121122.title: Green With Envy

13531112111211222.content: Well, there is already someone who is extremely jealous right now. A certain werewolf, shall we say?
13531112111211222.title: Someone Else Nearby

135311121112112221.content:
At the moment Stella releases the sin from its captivity, April happens to be walking nearby. The green orb floats over Roxy's head and makes a beeline for the werewolf. "What the-?" Stella says as you and Roxy turn to see where the sin is headed. April, unaware of what is happening, is simply collecting shells for her crafting. Just as she bends over to grab on the green ball of energy flies toward her round ass and enters her body. After standing back up with shell in hand she looks around, feeling a little strange. The feeling quickly goes away however and she continues with her business. She would, that is, if you and Roxy weren't walking up to her. "April!" you call. "Are you okay?" The werewolf tilts her head a little confused as she answers. "Yeah, why do you ask?" she responds. The moment she sees you however, a green tint, unseen to the rest of you, flashes in her eyes. "Uh, just checking." you tell her. You and Roxy look at each other nervously while she watches you. "Well, I have to get back to my shop." she says. "Unless you decided to leave Roxy for me?" she bends over to give you a view of her cleavage. Roxy rolls her eyes and you shake your head awkwardly. "Sorry, but no. I mean you're great and all but..." you stammer as April gives you a smirk. She bids the two of you goodbye and turns to leave. Her tail wags slowly as she walks, looking back at you once for good measure.

"So you wanna tell me what that was about?" Stella asks. Roxy gives her a sideways glare. "That bottle had the essence of envy trapped inside of it." she says in an annoyed tone. "It was supposed to stay trapped, but SOMEONE let it out and it possessed April." Stella just shrugs. "She seems fine to me." Roxy folds her arms with a frown. "I'm sure she does, but something's bound to happen. Opal told us that that much. The thing is concentrated envy." she says. You look at the werewolf walking away in the distance. "I guess we should just keep an eye on her for now." you suggest.

While you discuss the situation with Stella and Roxy, April is heading home unknowingly with sin in tow. Recalling how you were worried about her makes her smile. He's so thoughtful! I wish I had a sweetheart like him! she thinks to herself. Then her expression darkens a bit. Why does Roxy get to have him? I've loved him for as long as I've known him! She's been with him all this time and just NOW decides to make a move? Its faint, but her eyes are tinted green as these thoughts run through her mind. Its almost like she's just flaunting him in my face! I want him so bad! She continues ranting in her own head when suddenly she stops. Her eyes go back to normal and she regains herself, but her thoughts of you are still strong. As she walks along the street to her home she glances at a shop down the road. I wish my shop had a sign that nice. She has one more envious thought before entering her house/store.
135311121112112221.title: Yeah, It goes to April

choices: She Declines, But Roxy Doesn't Give Up
13531112112.content:
Once everyone is at the table you begin eating. Roxy made roast beef and mashed potatoes, with veggies on the side. You share off of Roxy's plate, and find it a little difficult to tear the meat. This is because its its actually a whole roasted cow. Seems Roxy isn't accustomed to making human sized portions. As you try bite into the cow she scoots you away with her claw. Then she slices it for you and lets you resume. "Thanks Roxy." you say. She smiles and begins eating herself. You look over at Petra and see that she's neater than Roxy. She doesn't eat slow, but its definitely her own pace. "So uh, Petra." you start. "How do you like being a cop?" Petra looks at you. "It's a full filling job." she answers. "It feels good to protect and serve. Its kind of a gargoyle instinct. Thats why most of us take jobs that protect others." You look up at your giant friend as she eats. "I guess that explains why you became a life guard, huh Roxy?" you ask. "But why didn't you become a cop too?" Roxy stops and looks down. "Well lets just say I didn't have the mentality for it." she answers. Petra raises her eyebrow and Roxy frowns. "Hey, I like to live a little!" she says. Petra sighs and smiles. "Well at least you're still helping people. Guess the instinct's still in you." she says. "Is your other sister a cop?" you ask. "No." Petra responds. "Janet didn't have much of an ambition for it either, but she still does good work. She's a counselor at a summer camp for girls. I can't help but be happy that she's looking out for kids." Petra is more talkative than you'd thought she'd be. You find yourself moving closer to have a better conversation.

"So you're the only police officer in the family?" you ask. "Nope." says Petra. "Our mother is one. She works over in Panicburg. Its a pretty bad neighborhood, so they have to have a good police force. Its made up of all gargoyles and mom's the chief. She's the best of the best." As if she's not even thinking Petra cuts a piece of her meat and offers it to you. You begin eating it when Roxy lets out a stifled laugh. "Whats so funny?' you say. "This, this situation." she answers, gesturing to you and Petra. "Petra's never opened up to anyone outside of the family like this. Talking about Janet and mom, looks like she likes you Stephen." Petra is visibly shaken up and blushes. "What do you mean? I'm just being nice." she says. "Oh? You're not usually this nice to strangers. Look, you're even sharing your plate with him!" Petra finally realizes she's been eating with you and blushes more. You meanwhile just look confused. As the two gargoyles argue you realize its the kind of argument two sisters would have.

"He's practically family already don't you think?" Roxy says pointing at the bandage on her neck.They're still going at it. "I know! Maybe you two should hook up!" she says teasingly. Petra is shocked, as well as you. You look at each other and then look away. This is not how expected this dinner to go. Petra looks just as lost you. She really must not be used to this kind of situation. "Come on, you've never even been on a date. Why don't you try it?" Roxy urges. Petra frowns. "Like you're one to talk! I don't see you with a guy. Hell, the only one of us close to having a boyfriend is Janet!" she counters. "Yeah, and she's going after a human, so why don't you?" Roxy says with a smile. Their sister likes a human? You're now more interested than before. Eventually the two sisters stop and focus on you. Roxy is grinning while Petra looks embarrassed. She seems to be trying to act cool and collected but can't hide the blush. "Come on, what do you say?" Roxy repeats.
13531112112.title: Unexpected Chemistry

135311121122.content:
"I don't know..." Petra says unsure of herself. Roxy keeps pressing her. "Why not? You're finally opening up to someone, just take a chance!" Roxy then looks to you. "How about it Stephen? She's quite a catch." She's not wrong. You have a thing for big women, but Petra's figure is definitely great too. "Well..I wouldn't mind." you say a little quietly. Petra blushes more and looks away. Roxy picks you up carefully and presents you like some sort of prize. "Come on, look at him." she says like she's holding a kitten or something. Petra is still being stubborn, but is definitely showing signs of cracking. This is probably why a girl as attractive as her is still single. She's so stoic and serious, it must be hard for guys to hit on her. The difference is that now her sister backed her into a corner. "Look, I need to use the bathroom." Petra says as she gets up. "I'll get her." Roxy says to you.

While Petra is gone you look up at Roxy. "Maybe you should leave her alone. If she doesn't want to she doesn't want to." you say. Roxy lifts you to her face. "Look, I know her better than you. She's definitely interested, and thats never happened before. Any guy who ever attempted to woo her's always gotten the cold shoulder." Then she looks like she realized something. "Now that I think about it, you've always had a bunch of girls after you. I never thought you'd get my sister though. Are you some kind of wizard? Maybe its the gargoyle skin." she ponders. You just shrug your shoulders a little embarrassed. You don't know why monster girls like you, it just sort of happens. "Just think though, if you hook up with Petra then you're set! She's good looking and she'll definitely protect you." Roxy says. She's really enthusiastic about this.

A booming sound signal's Petra's return. Before she gets there Roxy brings you closer. "Is your skin feeling okay?" she asks in a whisper. "Uh, yeah." you say. "Okay, then get ready. I have an idea." she tells you. Once Petra is there she sits back down, only for Roxy to stand up. She walks nonchalantly to her sister and pretends to trip. "Whoops!" she says and tosses you while making it look like an accident. You land right in Petra's cleavage and clench your teeth, waiting for the pain. It doesn't come however. Your skin is setting pretty well. It also helps that Petra's boobs are really soft. They might not be as big as Roxy's but they're still a good size. Its still pretty cool that their skin can be tough and soft at the same time. Petra carefully fishes you out and scolds her sister. "He could've been hurt!" she says. Roxy smiles and shrugs her shoulders. "Sorry, it was an accident!" she says unconvincingly. "He's already been through so much, he doesn't need you tossing hm around." Petra tells her. "Well you certainly seem like you're getting attached to him." Roxy says slyly. Petra notices that she's holding you closely and stroking you with a claw. She stops when she realizes what she's doing. "See, you won't admit it but there's definitely some interest." Roxy says. Finally Petra breaks. "Okay I'll give it a shot! Jeez!" she says. The two of you lock eyes and smile while Roxy laughs happily. The next day you have your date and...
135311121122.title: Petra Breaks

choices: There's A Robbery Across The Street!
1353111211222.content:
The next day you have your date with Petra. You're at Roxy's place until you leave. She's been teasing you since the other day. "Are you excited BRO?" she asks. You roll your eyes. "You were the one who set all this up." you tell her. She taps you on the head and chuckles. "Yeah but it was worth it right?" she says. Its a good thing your skin has set. That little tap would have hurt like hell a day ago. Soon there's a knock on the door and Roxy lets Petra in. "On the dot, as always." Roxy says. Petra is dressed casually, her figure making it look good. "Are you ready for your big day?" Roxy teases. Like you, Petra just rolls her eyes. "I've been dealing with this all morning." you tell her. "I don't think I've ever seen her this excited." Petra offers her hand, which you climb on. "Well she's never had many opportunities to mess with me, so when she finds one she goes all out." Petra explains. She then places you on her shoulder and leaves, with Roxy waving from the door.

"So whats the plan?" Petra asks you. "I haven't really thought about it." you say. "Do you have any ideas?" Petra nods and takes you off of her shoulder. "Hold on." she says, and takes off into the sky. As she flies you look down and see that she's heading away from Terrordale. You look up at her to ask where she's going but stop when you are confronted with her boobs. You decide to just wait until she lands since the view above and below is so good. When she's back on the ground you ask where you are. "Horrorville." she tells you. "I thought you might like a change of scenery, so I brought you to my town." Looking around you do notice that its different from Terrordale. It also seems good since she'll be the one walking and she knows the area.

Petra starts walking down the street as you look around. Suddenly you hear a voice from behind. "Hey babe, looking goo-" it starts before she turns around. The owner of the voice, a minotaur, stops short when he sees her face. She of course has to look down on him, and her stoic expression makes him back up. "Maza!" he says with a nervous look. Then he turns and walks away, getting faster by the second. "Uh, what was that about?" you ask. "Just a local troublemaker." Petra tells you. "I've had to deal with him a number of times. He was never too bright, guess he didn't recognize me out of uniform." He sure ran away quick, guess she's as tough as you thought. The two of you continue to walk down the street until...
1353111211222.title: On Petra's Turf

choices: The waitress arrives to take your orders
135311121122211.content:
You look up as Petra walks into a building. You read that it says the Cauldron Cafe. "You're gonna like the food here Stephen," says your gargoyle date. "I know the head chef, Bernice." You actually smile. Maybe Horrorville wasn't as dangerous as you thought. Petra walks up and sees a giantess mandrake resembling Venus McFlytrap, except with two sharp fangs sticking out of her mouth. Before the mandrake girl can speak, she sees you in Petra's cleavage and looks in surprise.

"What is that?" the mandrake waitress asks. "Ir look like a gargoyle but it's as big as a human." Petra simply glares at the mandrake who steps back from the much larger monster. "Uh, right this way ma'am." Soon, Petra is lead to a table where she takes her seat. She takes you out of her cleavage and the two of you read a large menu. You look outside to see several monsters passing by out the window. "Well," you say. "So this is Horrorville. It's actually kinda nice. Lila, Opal and Reimu were saying bad things about it the other day and said it was a dump." Petra lets out a laugh as she reads the menu. "That's the feud going on. Some of my neighbors have some harsh things to say about Terrordale. Personally, I think the feud is stupid. It's been going on ever since the cities were founded."

You look at the menu and see some odd things such as snake surprise, slime desert, roasted vulture salad. Basically everything monsters consider food. As you're pondering on what to order, you look up at your date. "So Petra. About your neighbors?" Petra smiles. "I've got tons of neighbors. Monster Arms is a big apartment. The only thing I don't like about it is the landlady." "Oh, she's mean?" "That's the understatement of the millennium. That three thousand year old used roll of toilet paper is the worst person I've ever met. She's a horrible tyrant and a worse landlady. She casts evil spells on anyone who can't pay the rent. I'll bet the only reason she made it to the afterlife is because her heart was so black and foul, it poisoned the devourer. Unfortunately, I can't arrest her for public obnoxiousness." Wow, it sounded like Petra really hated this landlady of hers. She must've been an even bigger bitch than Stella.

"As for my neighbors," says Petra. "I've got tons and I mean, literally tons of them, all crazier than the last. First is my next door neighbor, D.J. Elle, a thunderbird with attitude. It isn't a party until she starts cranking her tunes. Then there's the head chef at this cafe, Bernice, a fire genie who's a grouch most of the time, but she's a good friend." Petra lets out a laugh before speaking again. "Then there's Aqua, you might have seen her, she's a kelpie girl who practically lives on her surfboard." You actually distinctively remember seeing a kelpie resembling a fat equine version of Lagoona Blue on the Horrorville side of the beach. Maybe that was Aqua. "And last of my neighbors on my floor," said Petra. "Is Irene the cyclops." "Irene?" you ask. "Any relationship to anyone named Paula?" "Irene is Paula's daughter," says Petra. "She visits her every week. Kinda sweet since the old girl is screwed up in the head." "I know," you say. "Uh, Irene doesn't eat humans does she?" You remembered the last time you went to the K.D.P., Paula tried to eat you.

Petra lets out a gargoylish laugh at that thought. "Irene would never eat a human. The girl is a total health nut. She's always exercising and she refuses to eat anything fattening." You almost feel insulted. Does that mean Irene saw you as junk food? "Then there are my other neighbors. There's Georgia the artisan gorgon, Chel, the yeti nurse, the one monster in the apartment almost as big as me, then there are two troublemakers; Shelly, this kappa I'm investigating for too many fraud charges to list and Patsy, a neko girl biker who runs with a bad crowd." You actually gulp. You'd wonder who'd think about doing anything illegal in a building with a cop on the top floor?

"Then there's Mavis, a banshee opera singer who makes my ears want to vomit. That stubborn kook thinks she has the voice of an angel. A fallen angel is more like it." You laugh at Petra's joke. "And there's Alicia, a jabberwocky I'm investigating. I'm pretty sure she's on some illegal drugs. Then there's Izzy, a basilisk school teacher." A gorgon and a basilisk? You guess that this apartment has a lot of earth elemental monsters. "There's this manticore named Astrid who is keeping a human mate under the landlady's nose," continues Petra. "I forgot their gender though. Then there's Layla the dullahan, there's something about her that makes my skin crawl, that horrible centaur drunk Zelda, I feel sorry for her roommate Catalina, that man-hating hodag Renee, that schizophrenic chimera Bianca, that crybaby ghost Corlette, Giselle, the human-phobic sphinx and lastly there's Cadence."

"Cadence," you say. "That's a beautiful name. What type of monster is she?" "She's a zombie," says Petra. "Nice gal but she hasn't spoken coherently since she rose from her grave. She's an author, you might've read some of her books; Metropolis After Night, the Broken Mirror. She has a human roommate named R.L. you might get along with."

Wow, Petra sure had a colorful set of neighbors. "Wow," you say. "Sounds like an interesting place. Maybe I should visit." Petra bites her lip slightly and shakes her head. "That's not a good idea Stephen," she says. "You could run into Lupa." "Lupa?" you ask. "She's a big, fat, greedy werewolf obsessed with scarfing down every human she sees. No matter how many perish in her overstuffed belly, that wolf will always find room for more." You gulp. Then you remember something. April mentioned her cousin's name was Lupa. This must've been her. "You don't think Lupa would attack me do you Petra?" you ask. Petra shakes her head. "Not with your new skin," she says with a smile. "Lupa is a glutton, but she draws the line at cannibalism." Petra then lets out a sigh. "She must be thinking about... well, it's not important." Petra smiles lustfully at you and you smile at her.

You couldn't believe you were on a date with such a hot gargoyle. Sure, she could stand to gain a few... boulders... given your usual taste in girls. But she was still beautiful. Just then...
135311121122211.title: The Cafe

choices: At the end of the night, you schedule another date and go home.
You hit it off with Petra, and she takes you to her place for the night.
1353111211222111.content:
The mandrake waitress returns to your table, still looking at you oddly. A human with the skin of a gargoyle was probably a strange sight, and the mandrake didn't know what to think about it.
