"I still can't believe you have Roxy's skin now." Janet then notices the bandage on her sister's neck. "Ouch," she says. "Well, you should be safe now as soon as that heals. So, what's for dinner, Roxy."

Roxy gives a smirk. "Tomato soup." "Yeah," you say. "Thanks Roxy. A nice big fat red tomato." You then gasped. "Butt... I mean but, that doesn't mean... Roxy, don't you think that's a little heiny, I mean a little Heinous! Heinous!" Janet realizes what's going on and gives a laugh. "Oh, I get it." Janet spanks herself and laughs again. "I know. You see, my body is really weird. Most of the fat in my body goes right to my rear. Just look at this plump red tomato. Got me first place in Ms. Horrorville a few years ago." "Ms. Horroville?" you think to yourself. "So Janet's a pageant queen." You wonder if female gargoyles were considered attractive based on their weight.

Soon dinner is ready and Janet sits down, requiring three chairs to hold up her massive booty. You couldn't help but continue to stare. Janet then smirks. "Sorry to disappoint you, but I've got my eye on someone else." "You and Elisa and many others," says Roxy as she bites into stegosaurus steak. "Still in the running are you?" Janet gave a smirk. "Yep. Just you wait, Edgar is going to be my husband and I'm going to bear his eggs, you'll see." "Edgar?" you ask. Roxy lets out a sigh and hands you a small slice of her meat. "There's a male counselor at the camp that Janet works at. However, Janet has a lot of competition. Even Elisa." "Bah," scoffed Janet. "That hippopotamus isn't going to get my man." "What species is he?" you ask. "Gargoyle? Werewolf?" "Human," said Janet. "Although he was raised by a Nidhogg." "Stephen, do you remember Sora? That's her brother." You heard that Sora had an adoptive human brother. You guessed that was him.

"Isn't it dangerous for a human to work in a camp with so many female monsters?" you ask. "That's not a problem," says Janet. "Edgar has been enchanted so he can't ever be killed. He's been eaten hundreds of times, sat on thousands of times, mostly by me, nothing can destroy him. Of course, there are a lot of girls after him besides me and Elisa. There's Dolly Fleece, a big fat golden weresheep who was raised by humans. She even keeps her folks in her cabin with her. There's that party animal pumpkin head, Nat, that garbage disposal kappa, Skyla, then there's Heloise, that hellhound deadbeat. She's only in the camp to avoid going back to jail. I reported her last week and got her in big trouble with Kaylee for bringing bourbon to the premises. Heck, there are even so girls who don't work at the camp who I have to worry about."

"Sounds like Edgar is really popular." You say. "Well," says Janet. "Seeing as you're still recovering and won't be ready to return to work for days, Camp Darkly opens tomorrow. Perhaps you can be a guest." Roxy gives a look of worry. She's not 100% confident how well you'd do with all those little monster girls.

So what's your reply?
1353111212.title: Janet

choices: Elisa Flies Down and Notices You
Robyn Comes in for a Last Minute Inspection
13531112121.content:
You think about Janet’s offer and give a smile. “Well, I suppose it couldn’t hurt.” Janet gives a smile and eats a piece of fried pterodactyl. “I don’t know about that, Stephen,” says Roxy as she picks at her dinner and gives you a piece. “All those little monster girls. Edgar and Elisa and Janet can handle them but...” Janet let out a scoff. “It’s just for the day, Roxy. Don’t get overheated.” Roxy gives a sigh. “Okay. But remember, just because he has new skin doesn’t mean Stephen is indestructible.” Janet gives a laugh. "Oh don't worry. He'll be safe with me. Besides, they wouldn't have hired me as a counselor otherwise." Janet lets out another laugh and Roxy laughs as well, albeit more nervously.

- - - - - - - - - -

The next day Janet is flying over the woods outside Horroville with you on her shoulder. You couldn’t believe the number of trees. “Wow,” you say. “This is a nice change of pace.” Janet gives a laugh and then flies down and you arrive at a camp. The summer camp is called Camp Darkly from the looks on the sign and it was a rather large camp. “How many counselors are at the camp.” “Including Edgar and me,” said Janet. “13. There has to be at least 13 counselors. It’s the law in these parts. The inspector threatened to shut us down otherwise.” “Inspector?” “Robyn Queen,” says Janet. “She’s an obnoxious hobgoblin who’s always on our case, badgering us about the safety of the camp.” That Robyn sounded a lot like Stella from the looks of it.

At the camp, you could see several of the counselors. First of them was a yellow-green skinned kappa with reddish brown spots and long green hair. She was apple-shaped with a big belly and D-Cup breasts and was stuffing her face with potato chips. She appeared to have finished five bags already and at one point she paused from eating her chips to bite into a whoopie pie. Clearly she was a bigger pig that Carmen. You take it that kappa woman was Skyla.

There was also a giant obese weresheep with a round booty (though not nearly as big as Janet’s) and F-cup breasts. She had silver horns that curved downwards and long thick golden fleece that glittered. She was also wearing a pink version of the counselor uniform complete with bedazzles. That must’ve been Dolly.

Next of the girls was a chuby girl with long blonde hair and C-cup breasts. She looked almost normal if a little albino, except that her body looked like it was made of wood and she had a giant pumpkin for a head. She was giggling as she was putting up banners. That was clearly Nat. She appeared to be humming “Are You Ready for the Summer” to herself as she stopped and clapped her hands. She definitely looked like she belonged in a camp for little girls.

Then another girl showed up and you saw that that counselor looked anything but qualified for her job. She was a fat-gutted black-furred hellhound with horns where her ears should’ve been, C-cup breasts, a devil’s tail and long red hair. She was carrying a scrub brush and a bucket of cleaning supplies but what made you really surprised was that she was smoking a cigarette. And she’s supposed to be working with children? The hellhound woman glares at Janet as she walks by. “Thanks for getting me stuck on latrine duty, asshole.” Says the hellhound woman to Janet. “Watch your language, Heloise,” warns Janet. “There will soon be children present.” Heloise just spits her cigarette at Janet’s feet in spite. “Wow,” you say. “She really doesn’t like you.” Janet lets out a scoff. “She’s the competition. I have seven rivals for Edgar in the camp alone.” You let out a whistle and then you hear a loud chewing sound.

You turn your head and see that there’s an obese bright yellow-furred werewolf girl who looked like she was one of April’s MANY cousins. She was wearing a red hood over her head and she also had golden brown hair. She had E-cups and a massive rear. You then see a skeletal human hand sticking out of the wolf girl’s mouth and your skin turns pale. On her shoulder was a human who didn’t seem afraid of her. He looked your age and had tan-skin and silver hair. You realize that that was probably Edgar. It would make sense that if he was immortal like Janet said he was, he wouldn’t be afraid of the werewolf girl, but it should’ve disturbed him that she was chowing down on a human. She quickly slurps the remains of her meal and then gags before she drinks from her canteen. “You ate too fast again, Miranda,” says Edgar. “You always eat too fast.” “Bite me, Edgar.” Says the wolf woman.

“So that’s Edgar. He looks like quite a catch. But I’m afraid that werewolf has him today.” Janet gives a scoff. “Miranda is a lesbian,” she says. “I have nothing to worry about from her. She’s Edgar’s best friend, not his girlfriend.” “You’re kidding me? She’s his version of Roxy? But she eats humans. Doesn’t that bother him?” Janet shrugs her shoulders and then smiles as she walks up to Miranda and Edgar and shakes her breasts and smirks. “Hello, Edgar. Happy first day of summer. Another year with big red. Rowr.” Edgar blushes as Janet wiggles her tail and Miranda shrugs it off. Skyla and Dolly turn their heads and glare at Janet. Then Dolly notices you on Janet’s shoulder and smirks. “Be careful, Edgar. She’s a cold-hearted snake. Looks like you’re not satisfying enough for her.” Edgar grunts and then looks in surprise to see you. Miranda notices you as well and you’re concerned that she’ll eat you. Then she sniffs you and raises an eyebrow. “Is that a human? He smells like a gargoyle.” You wave nervously as Janet turns around and glares at her rivals.

“For your information, Stephen is a friend of my sister’s. I barely even know him.” “Bologna,” says Skyla before she chews into a bologna sandwich. “You’re already in the lead so you’re being smug about your supposed beauty.” “Go stick your mouth back into a bag of potato chips, Skyla.” Says Janet. Dolly gives an angry bleat. “You know, Janet, your arrogance is really irking me. I’d kick your ass but I’d lose a good foot in the process.” “Language! Your ears must be so stuffed with that ridiculous wool that you can’t hear me, you ovine creep.” You gulp. Yikes. You only saw four of Janet’s rivals but three of them were already hostile to her. Poor Edgar has an entire harem of Aprils who’d probably kill each other. That’s when Nat notices you and lets out a squee. “Another friend! Sweet! Is he a new counselor? I’m Nat! I’m sure we’ll get along very well! Of course, I already have eyes for Edgar but I still like you as a friend, I hope!” You raise an eyebrow. “She must have sugar for blood.” Then Nat realizes something. “Hey, how come his skin looks weird?” Skyla takes a closer look and is surprised. “Nat’s right. His skin looks like a gargoyle’s.” “That’s because my sister gave him a skin graft. He was nearly cooked to death.”

Edgar’s face turns pale upon hearing that. “Oh geez.” “So his skin was replaced with gargoyle skin,” says Miranda. “Guess I can’t eat him.” Edgar gives a glare at his friend. “Really, Miranda?” Miranda gave a scoff. “I was joking. Sheesh. Just because I’m the only counselor who eats humans, everyone picks on me.” You give a gulp. What a crew Janet worked with. This looks like it will be interesting.

Suddenly...

(Please see this link for more information http://www.writing.com/main/campfires/it...)
13531112121.title: Camp Darkly

1353112.content:
You look in the mirror and see that your destroyed skin had been completely replaced. Your new skin was blue, but thankfully not the cyan shade of blue like that tengu that got you into this mess to begin with. Your new skin appeared to have come from Fran. You're speechless. You now had the skin of a troll. Roxy gives an uneasy look. "When Fran heard about how severe the damage those two did to you was, we didn't have to twist her arm for her to be a skin donor. Sorry, if it's a ...."

"Blue," you say. "I'm going to be blue for the rest of my life." You then start to scratch at your exposed body. "Not to mention itchy," you grumble. "It feels like there's sandpaper under this skin." Roxy gently grabs one of your arms between her clawed fingertips. "Don't scratch," she says. "You might reopen the skin before it sets. The nurse said you were practically a skeleton until they grafted that blue skin on you. One wrong move and your insides might fall apart."

You let out a groan and have to hold your nose to cough. You smelled like troll blood. Fran must've given up a very sensitive part of skin to help you heal. "Thanks Roxy," you say. "I seriously thought you were going to eat me." Roxy gives a look that almost seems like she's offended. "Never ever, I'll admit I could stand to lose some weight, but I'd never eat a human. That was a horrible trick for them to play on you. Mesa's lucky she's not in jail with Hannah for nearly killing a lifeguard. I heard she relocated to Fearfield. Carmen is going crazy waiting for us to find a replacement chef." You let out a grunt. "I hope the next one's a vegetarian. Nearly made into a burger by a cow, if that's not irony I don't know what is."

That's when Roxy turns her head and you stand up in the hospital bed as you hear footsteps. One of the nurses, a giant hourglass shaped weredeer girl with gold colored antlers, came forward. "You've got a visitor to check up on you Mr. Dukes."

Roxy moves to the side as another monster walks forward carrying a big bouquet of flowers, but who is it?
1353112.title: Feeling Blue

135312.content:
Roxy is unable to hear your muffled screams as she takes the first bite of the burger. You feel the pressure of her teeth as they cut through the bun just below your feet. The bun around you begins getting chewed up as you slip out onto Roxy’s tongue. You are now where you never thought you would end up. Within the moist cavern of roxy’s mouth. “Roxy!” you shout “Stop Eating its me Stephen!” but judging by the fact that she was still chewing she clearly couldn’t hear you. And if the noises she was making were any indication it was clear that she was enjoying the burger.

On the outside Hannah and Mesa exchange knowing smiles as Roxy compliments Mesa on her cooking. “This has got to be the best burger I’ve ever had” she says “New recipe?” Mesa smiles “No its an old recipe with a bit of a . . . Familiar new ingredient” Mesa chuckles. Roxy slows down her chewing and fixes Mesa with a confused look “What does that mean?” “Oh nothing you need to concern yourself with honey, just chef talk.” She says quickly covering up her slip of the tongue “If you like it so much I may give you the recipe”

You continue dodging Roxy’s tongue as you try and call out to your partner. Due to the conversation going on outside however Roxy cannot hear you. As she closes her lips one final time you catch a glimpse of Hannah smiling evilly at you. Raising her hand she gives you a slight wave and mouths the words “Have a nice trip” before you are sealed away in Roxy’s mouth. You start to scream as Roxy raises her head up but are cut of as her tongue finally gains purchase on you. You are forced against the roof of her mouth and pushed back with the chewed remains of the burger. You get a sinking sensation as you hear a large gulp and are forced into her throat.

Mesa and Hannah exchange grins as they see a bulge travel down Roxy’s throat and disappear behind her collarbone. She lets out a burp ad pats her gut. Soon Roxy has finished off the burger and has begun wiping her mouth off. “Damn that was a good meal” she says letting out another burp to accentuate her point “You hhve to give me that recipe Mesa” “Well here is a writeup of the recipe honey” Mesa says with a smile “everything you need to know is on there, and I can make that for you any time.” “Thanks Mesa” Roxy says as she quickly reads the ingredient list “Wait what is this?” she says suddenly shocked “Does this say human?!?!”. “Of course suggah you know I use humans in most of my recipes” “But you didn’t use them in this burger did you?” Roxy asks. “Well of course I did. And let me tell you, you seemed to enjoy it quite a bit.” “Good gods” Roxy says “I think I’m . . .”
135312.title: Side of human

choices: You're Digested (Continue the Story from Roxy's POV)
1353122.content:
Out of pure horror, Roxy grabs the sides of her head. "... I... I think I'm.. actually starting to like the taste of humans." Mesa lets out a laugh at that as Hannah gives a sadistic grin. "Well y'all should, honey," said Mesa. "After all, in the monster world, they're at the bottom of the food chain. I just love the taste and feel of the little critters going down my throat." Mesa swings her hips as she says this, but this just makes Roxy feel even more sick. "But I'm a gargoyle, Mesa!" yells Roxy. "Gargoyles aren't supposed to eat humans! We're supposed to protect humans from getting eaten." Mesa shrugs her shoulders and smiles. "I'm sure that once in a while a garg gal likes to experiment with her diet."

Roxy gets up and walks away feeling her stomach in guilt. "I can't believe I just ate a human," she said. "And liked it. This isn't good. I needy to work this out, maybe stop by a bar after work and maybe see how well the little morsels do with rum. Oh my gosh! What am I saying?! Calm down Roxy. Man, what am I going to tell Stephen. Right now I can't help but see my best friend wrapped in a hotdog bun with mustard. Where is Stephen anyway? I gotta find him before some predator gets him. And then I can have him all to myself." Roxy grabs herself by the mouth in horror at her own words.

What Roxy didn't know was that you were in fact in her belly. It was enormous. Given how fat Roxy was, it would be possible to build a human city in her ginormous gut. You look around in horror as you stand on bits of digesting burger. You always lived in fear a monster would eat you, but you never thought that it would be Roxy. Not to mention you were so burned from Mesa cooking you that you could barely stand at all. You look around and see remains of fishbones and dinosaur bones and they were slowly eroding. Unfortunately, the burger you were on was eroding just as fast. You weakly look down at the stomach acid and cough. If you fell in there, you'd wind up as nothing more than a few extra inches on Roxy's fat ass. You had to get her attention. It wasn't too late.

You quickly grab a fishbone and row your dissolving burger boat until you reach the edge of the stomach. You start to pound on Roxy's bloated stomach wall from the inside, making small bulges appear where her navel would be if she didn't come from an egg-laying species. "Roxy!" you shout. "Roxy! It's me, Stephen! I'm in your tummy! You gotta throw me up right now!" You look back to see the burger was dissolving beneath your feet. If Roxy didn't hear you, you'd melt in her stomach.

But does your obese gargoyle friend hear you?
1353122.title: Roxy's Belly

13532.content: "Why don't we see if Connie's hungry." Says Hannah with an evil look. You let out a gasp. You were going to be eaten by that BBW goth naga you have a crush on. "Coming right..." Before Mesa goes through with it, she stops in her tracks. "Hey, wait a minute... isn't Connie allergic to humans? I don't really feel like getting sued." Hannah realizes this, but unfortunately, she knows how to lie with a straight face on. "Oh, are you kidding? What kind of naga doesn't like slurping down humans. It's not as if Connie doesn't know how to swallow her prey." Mesa lets out a groan and you would say that Hannah is lying but she unwittingly covers your mouth with a finger and then shrugs her shoulders. "I hope you're right Hannah. I could get in big trouble for poisoning a customer. The only question is... how should I prepare this little man?" Mesa looks down at you and you tremble in her grip? How does she decide to cook you for the naga girl? Especially since she doesn't know Connie can't eat humans. You're in fear at the thought she was going to somehow cook you without killing you.
13532.title: Naga Bait

14.content:
You decide to check on the regulars at the beach. They're hear unusually early. As you walk down the beach, you wonder which one you should check on. It's your duty to make sure nothing is going wrong with them. First there was Kath, the weretiger painter. For a tigress she wasn't that aggressive and you see that she's setting up an easel right now. Maybe you can observe her art.

Then there was also Opal, the carbuncle fortune teller in her tent of telekinesis. You never visited her, but you were told that her predictions were almost always accurate. But maybe it wasn't a good idea. You didn't know if she even liked humans.

You could check on Mesa, that minotaur girl who runs the beach grill. She was very friendly when you and Roxy made your rounds and gave you free food sometimes. But she did always joke about making you into a meal one day. At least, you hope that she's joking.

Then there was April, that pear shaped dire werewolf girl. She ran a trinket store where she made jewelry out of shells and tiles on the beach. But April was just crazy about you and wanted you as her boyfriend. You're certain she jiggled that big behind all the time as to get your attention. Of course, you're afraid to find out how far she'd go to have you.

Lastly there was a monster you didn't know that well, Laura, the four headed hydra scuba diver and she was walking forward in her wetsuit right now. Of course, everyone told you she was nothing but Horrorville trash and that she doesn't belong in Terrordale. But Terrordale and Horrorville's history is unknown to you and Laura didn't seem so bad to you?

So who are you going to check up on.
14.title: Beauties and the Beach

141.content:
You've never really gotten to know Kath. She's a weretigress, but she doesn't seem like the typical predator. she's kind of shy and doesn't interact with the other monsters on the beach. You know that she's a painter, but you've never actually seen any of her work. She's just finished setting up her easel and you decide to go say hi. You start to say something but then see that she looks really focused. Not wanting to break her concentration you just stand back and watch her work.

She begins to paint and you wonder what exactly the end result will be. You're definitely not an expert, but you think Kath seems to really know what she's doing. Every stroke of the brush seems so natural to her. Eventually the picture begins to form and you see that she's painting the shoreline. Once you think she's done you decide to speak up. "It looks really nice." you say.

Kath jumps at your voice and turns around. She sees you and begins to blush under her white fur. "Um, I didn't know you were there." she says shyly. "Well I didn't want to disturb you." you tell her. " I thought I'd wait until you were done to say anything." She looks away slightly. "I'm not actually done yet." she says. "Oh, then please, don't mind me." you say as you gesture towards the easel.Kath hesitantly turns back her painting and puts on the finishing touches, but what is she adding?
141.title: Kath, the weretigress painter

1412.content:
You look at the painting and see that she's adding what looks like a person. When she's done you see that the person is you! You look up at Kath and she looks at you. She gives you a smile and averts her eyes slightly. "Uh, nice work." you tell her. Its true, the painting is good, you just don't know why she put you in it. "Why am I in it though?" She answers, although it seems like she's forcing herself. She really is shy. "Well...you're the only human on the beach, you're unique."

You're flattered that someone thinks you're art worthy."Why am I so small in it?" you ask. She looks down at you. "Well you are small." she says this like its obvious. "It makes the painting more realistic." You can't argue with that. She is the artist after all. "Its really good, did you paint me by memory?" She gets shy again. "Yes, I studied you whenever I saw you." You think that she could have just asked you to model for her, but then remember how shy she is.

"Well its pretty good." you say. "Do you have any paintings of anyone else?" She shakes her head. "No, this is the first one I've done. I need to study someone before I can paint another one." Kath is a really nice girl. You want to help her so you make a suggestion. "If you don't think you know anyone well enough, I can ask them to model for you." She's a little surprised. "Really?" she says a little eagerly. "Sure, lets go find someone." you say. Kath places you on her shoulder and packs up her stuff. The two of you go to find someone to paint, but who?
1412.title: A Small Addition

choices: She's a little uncomfortable with it.
14121.content:
You and Kath walk along the beach and you try to think of a good subject for her to paint. As you ponder this you see Roxy walking towards you. You suddenly think to yourself that she would be a good choice. She's a pretty girl and has a nice body, even if she's kind of heavy. Heck, you think that's one of her best qualities. You wave at her as you near each other.

"Hey Stephen! I was wondering where you were." she says to you. "Yeah, I was just getting to know Kath here." you tell her as you gesture up to the weretigress. "Have you two met?" Roxy shakes her head. "Not officially, no." she says as she reaches out for a handshake. Kath nervously shakes her hand and gives a small hello. You smile at her encouragingly and get to the point. "Kath here is a great painter,and she's looking for subjects. How'd you like to model for her?" Roxy blushes at this. "Me? I don't know, are you sure I'm good enough to paint?" You're pretty sure she's hesitant because she's a little sensitive about her weight. "If I'm good enough, then a girl like you definitely is." Roxy thinks about it and eventually agrees.

Soon after Kath has her easel set up and Roxy is sitting on the beach as her model. She's looking a little nervous, but still manages to keep it together. She's not even really posing, just sitting there. This is good enough though, as Kath is deep in concentration. You're just enjoying watching her work, not to mention watching Roxy. When Kath finishes she shows the two of you the painting. You think it looks great, but what does Roxy think?
14121.title: Painting Roxy

141212.content:
Roxy looks at the painting with a mixed expression. You know that its good, but she might not be completely happy with it. You're pretty sure its because she's a little sensitive about her weight. This makes no sense to you, as she's a beautiful girl. She's just bigger than most, but in a good way. At least you think so, but the subject of her size can make her snap at people.

"So, Roxy?" you ask her tentatively. She gives you a smile that seems kind of forced. "Its great." she says with some hesitation. Her tone of voice causes Kath to become worried. This is bad, if Kath thinks Roxy doesn't like it she might lose confidence. You just got her to come out of her shell. You motion for Roxy to pick you up, which she does. She brings you to her face, and you whisper to her. "Come on, you have to admit that you look great in this." She looks away slightly and mumbles. "I know! Its just-" You cut her off. "Just do this for Kath, she needs a confidence boost."

Roxy nods her head and looks at Kath. "Its great! I don't think I've ever looked better!" You think she might be overdoing a little, but at least she sounds convincing.This is a good opportunity for both of them. Both the subject and the artist are fantastic, and they both need to acknowledge it. Kath breathes a sigh of relief and smiles. "You really think so?" You look up at her. Of course!" In the middle of your little art critique someone happens by and sees the painting. Who is it?
141212.title: Reservations

1412121.content:
Roxy looks happy that Kath is feeling more confident. Thats probably the reason the she didn't protest to the painting in the first place. Sure she looked big in it, but thats what she was really like. You recall Kath saying the same thing to you about being small. She sure did capture people accurately in her work. You're glad she's showing pride in herself.

Unfortunately while everyone's feeling good, you hear one of your least favorite voices. "What's this? Three losers having a party?" It was Stella the fairy. She was a lifeguard on the beach like Roxy. Unlike Roxy however, she was rude, condescending, and just unpleasant. She walks up to the three of you and regards Kath. "So someone finally got her to come out of her shell huh? Pretty pathetic for a weretiger to be such a chicken." Kath shrinks back at the insult. You and Roxy however come to her aid. "Lay of her, she's just shy!" you shout at the fairy. Stella eyes you with a smirk. "Then it makes sense she wouldn't open up to normal people. I guess you and stone face here are good enough." She says, ridiculing you all.

"For your information, Kath is an artist. She even painted a great portrait of Roxy!" you counter, trying to prove her wrong. Stella just regards the painting and scoffs. "This thing? I wouldn't brag about it. Though maybe with some practice she'll be able to paint someone like me one day!" Her haughty tone is making you angry. Kath however, takes it personally and cowers a little. Roxy sees this and won't stand for it. "You'd be lucky if she ever painted you!" Stella sees that she's got you all riled up and continues to pour it on. "Why paint her anyway? Its a wonder she can even fit in the frame!" Uh oh, this could get ugly. "I'm surprised the thing hasn't broken the easel and sunk into ground with a fatty like her in it!" You can tell Roxy is starting to lose it, the look on her face is getting angrier and angrier. "I mean, I've seen heavy statues before, but this one takes the cake!" That did it. Roxy lets out a roar and goes after Stella. The fairy spreads her butterfly wings however and takes to the sky laughing. Roxy follows suit and spreads her own leathery wings to take after her. Is she still holding you, or does she drop you before taking flight?
1412121.title: Destructive Criticism

14121211.content:
Stella takes off into the sky and Roxy follows. Unfortunately she's forgotten to let go of you and now you're coming along for the ride. You rise higher and higher into the air as Roxy chases the obnoxious fairy. "Roxy!" you try to call out to her. She doesn't seem to be paying attention though. Looks like Stella has her full attention. You hope to god that she doesn't accidentally let go of you.

The two winged monsters are now well into the sky. Stella seems to be staying ahead and out of Roxy's reach. Your gargoyle friend is flying quite fast but can't quite catch her. They go straight, in circles and even do some loops. Meanwhile you feel like you're going to throw up. At least you haven't been dropped yet. Stella is pretty confident that she won't get caught so she turns around in mid-flight. "You don't really think you can catch me do you? Its a miracle something this heavy can even get into the air! I'll bet your wings are about to fall off!" she calls out. Stella's taunts give Roxy the extra push she needs. She grits her teeth and makes her wings work overtime. She moves a little faster, then suddenly has a burst of speed. This catches Stella off guard, and she finds herself in the gargoyle's grasp.

Roxy grabs her and you are flung from her claws in the process. You scream like crazy but don't appear to be headed for the ground. Instead you find yourself caught between the two monsters. As they grapple and struggle with each other you are bounced off of their bodies. Since their so close together they're keeping you contained with their bodies. You hope that you can survive this midair cat fight. Eventually Roxy gets the better of Stella and the two of them begin to go down. You feel the descent and pray that their bodies will cushion your fall. Soon they hit the ground with a huge boom and continue to fight. Roxy is clearly stronger than the fairy and pins her down. Before she can deliver a well deserved punch however, she is interrupted.

"Roxy. What you doing?" asks Fran, your supervisor. She happened to be there when the two of them landed. Roxy and Stella both jump to their feet and try to explain themselves. "We just bumped into each other while we were flying." Stella says quickly. "Thats right, and I was trying to help her up." Roxy adds. Fran's not the brightest monster, so she buys their story. "Okay. You be more careful. Now have nice day!" she says with a smile and walks away. The two girls glare at each other. "I'll get you next time you pest." Roxy says. "Whatever." Stella responds and the two of them go their separate ways. Meanwhile you find yourself wedged deeply in someone's cleavage. You ended up here during their rough landing. Who's cleavage is it?

141212111.content:
You look and see that the cleavage was bright yellow, which meant that there's was only one person you could be stuck to. It was Roxy and you were shaking in her boobs as the titanic yellow orbs shook. "Roxy!" you shout. "Roxy!" The gargoyle giantess looks down and then lifts you up with her claws as her boobs bounce. "I'm sorry about that Stephen," she said. "Mother Weisman, I should've made sure you were safe first. Ooh, that Stella makes me so mad. Not only was she mean to Kath, but she had to..." Roxy grits her teeth and her eyes turned red just thinking about that obnoxious sprite.

That fairy had quite a mouth on her and one of the things you appreciated the least about her was the fact that she seemed to think that a girl had to be skinny to be beautiful. It's not Roxy's fault that next to nobody can be as skinny as a fairy. Nothing more than flying twigs. Personally, you thought Roxy looked like a bombshell, but you were into SSBBW monster girls like Connie. Nothing set off Roxy more than when somebody made fun of her weight and as you sit on the gargoyle's shoulder and she flies into the air, you wonder how you could teach Stella a lesson about the female body."

Hours pass and it's closing time at the beach. Roxy lays you on the ground before waving at you. "Well," says your gargoyle friend. "It's quitting time, Stephen. I'll be seeing you tomorrow." "Have a good night, Roxy." You say. Roxy lets out a laugh. "I'm a gargoyle, Stephen. Every night's a good night for me." You're walking back to the lifeguard station and you're about to climb the ladder to your home in the fire cabinet but then somebody kicks the ladder and causes it to break as you yell and fall to the ground. "Oopsie." Says a mocking voice. You look up and see Stella laughing at you and looking down on you. No doubt she was the one who broke your ladder.

Then she has the nerve to kick you to the side before walking out and laughing. You let out a grumble. Thanks to that stupid fairy, you couldn't even get into your own room. "I'm starting to hate fairies." You say to yourself. Well, you figure that while it is risky, maybe there was still somebody on the beach who could help you get in the fire extinguisher cabinet. Or eat you if you were unlucky.

You figure you'd walk close to the KDP. Maybe Whitney or Diana was punching out and could help you. But as you're walking ahead, you are almost trampled by a giant pink cat's pawn and you yell. You look up to see a monster giantess dressed as a gypsy woman. It was Opal, the fortuneteller and from the looks of it, she heard your scream. "Stephen?" she asks. "What are you doing here? Shouldn't you be in your fire cabinet?" You grunt. "Stella broke my ladder, Opal. Could you lend me a hand." Opal let out a growl. "Stella," she says with venom in her voice. "I should've known. Don't worry." Opal picks you up and then walks into the lifeguard station to take you back into the house and even took some tape from a nearby desk to repair the ladder. "There," says the fortuneteller. "That should fix it."

"Thanks, Opal," you say. "Man, that Stella is the biggest bitch I've ever met. How did she become a lifeguard with her bad attitude." "Well," says Opal. "You obviously haven't met the fair folk. Most of them are real donut holes." You mumble. "But not only did Stella torment me, she bullied Kath earlier and she made fun of Roxy's weight... again. I'd like to..." Opal then gave a smile. "This one's on the house." She said under her breath.

That night, Opal returned to her tent and drew two magic symbols on a piece of wood and put two wax figurines on the symbols. One was sculpted to look like Roxy and the other was made to look like Stella. Opal said some magic words and the symbols lit up and made the figurines glow. Opal kept chanting and then the wax figurines lit on a magical fire before she smiled. "Let's see how Stella likes it when the shoe is on the other foot."

The next day, you wake up early and decide to go on an early patrol. If Opal hadn't fixed the ladder that Stella broke, you'd never be able to get down. As you walk forward, you see a shadow and look up into the air to see a flying monster and look in surprise.

1413.content:
As you gaze upon the easel and Kath's huge furred hand, you couldn't help but realize the similar figures being blotched in. After just a few minutes, to your utter surprise, you managed to spot a rather realistic portrayal of Kath herself. While Kath did look great in the painting, what surprised you the most was the sight of your very own form right besides her. While at first glance it did appear just like any typical human, but there was no denying the keen features on the figure. "wow..." you mutter gazing up at the painting in awe and slight confusion. "it looks great...but...why exactly did you add me?" you ask her with a slightly raised brow. "I wasn't really in the landscape..."

Above, Kath's furred face exhibited an even deeper shade of red by the comment as she quickly averts her eyes and raises her shoulders slightly. "Is...I-is it strange?" she asks in a concerned tone, as if unsure she did something insulting to you.

"N-no! not at all!" you quickly retort while waving your hands up dismissively. "I'm not angry or anything...it's just...that I'm just curious why you wanted to add me." you ask truthfully as Kath's large head slowly turns back to the painting.

"w-well..." she stammers. "I...I just thought it would seem right to add you in the painting...s-seeing as how you work here." She replies, though to be honest it was hard to tell if she was being completely honest or not. Unsure whether or not you should press on with questioning her artistic inclusion, you ultimately decide to drop the topic.

"I see." you nod your head acceptingly while gazing at the small painting of you. "well, you certainly do have my scale perfect." You add humorously as a small giggle managed to escape Kath above.

"T-thanks." She replies before finally turning to gaze down upon your miniscule form. As you return a gaze up at her huge orbs, one dying question soon manages to envelop your mind.

"Hey Kath?" you call the massive feline curiously.

"y-y-yeah?" She stammers with wide eyes for a brief moment.

"Not to seem intrusive...but how come you spend most of your time alone?" While you were already well aware of how shy she was, you always did wonder how she would be like if she was to hang out with either you or one of the other beachgoers.

A long pause emerged from the question as Kath once again averts her eyes. "w-well...you see...I'm not so social around...others." she states

"Really?...well...why not just hang out with others on the beach?" you ask curiously. "there's tons of people here, and I'm sure you'll manage to make some really awesome friends if you get out there."

Kath's eyes widen by the suggestion as a shade of red became visible underneath her fur, "b-but...what if they don't like me, or what if I'm too strange or something?" she counters as her voice quivered slightly. Just by her tone alone, it seemed she was extremely anxious about interacting with others.

"Well...why not hang out with someone who's a regular here?" you ask.

"l-l-like who?" Kath replies as her head slowly cocks to the left.

Her whole body was electricity, with the eletricity on her head forming a ponytail. She didn't have a mouth, yet you could hear her snoring. She was very fat, even bigger than Connie was.

You were confused. "Um, who is this?" You ask Roxy.

"No idea. I came back to the station to get some sunscreen and she just popped out of the electrical socket, plopped on the couch, and went to sleep. I told Fran about her." Roxy explained.

Opal herself seemed surprised and disturbed to see the leopard giantess. “How may I help you?” the carbuncle fortuneteller says. “What are you doing in here?” asked Mia. Opal gave a hiss. “Excuse me? I have more right to be here than you. This is my Tent of Telekinesis.” The leopard giantess blinks and then rubs her chin with her mechanical arm. “You mean that this isn’t a changing room? Damn.” The girl whacks herself in the face before she walks out. You’re forced to run to avoid getting stepped on and then you yell as you trip and grab the leopard lady’s tail.

This in turn startles the leopard woman and she looks down at you before she plucks you off of her tail with her mechanical arm. It felt strange being in a robotic hand. It was so cold and felt like a pair of metallic rocks. You even shiver before the leopard takes you up to her face and notices your lifeguard uniform. “A human lifeguard on a beach for giant monsters?” she asks. “You must be Stephen.” You were confused. You had never seen this titaness in your life and yet this 850ft high wereleopard knew your name. For that matter, why wasn’t she eating you? After all, she was clearly a carnivorous monster.

Before you can even think of the matter, you hear a flapping noise and Roxy soars down from the sky and notices the feline giantess. “Mia?” asks your gargoyle friend. “Roxy!” yells the leopard girl. Mia places you on her shoulder before she and Roxy exchange a large hug and laugh to each other. “I haven’t seen you in months, you metal moggy,” says Roxy. “I see that ass of yours has gotten bigger.” Mia gives a purr and a laugh. “Like you’re really one to talk about people’s weight. Janet and Petra grew past you in height because you were too busy growing the other way.” Roxy just gives a scoff and then notices you. “Oh. Hey, Stephen.” Roxy takes you from Mia’s shoulder and you blink.

Did Roxy seriously say that Mia was her cousin? Wereleopards and gargoyles aren’t even similar species and you weren’t really sure how gargoyles were classified in the animal kingdom. Heck, wereleopards are born alive while gargoyles hatch from eggs. You then decide to speak your mind. “Roxy,” you say. “Mia’s a wereleopard. You’re a gargoyle. How could she be your cousin?” Mia gives a scoff. “I’m adopted,” she says. “Duh.” Well, that made sense.

“Mia lives in Direopolis,” says Roxy. “It’s a mountaintop village that’s half a day away from Terrordale. I didn’t even know you were coming Mia.” Mia gave a laugh. “Surprise, cousin. Roxy lets out a sigh. “Direopolis is a very strange town. From what Mia tells me, the townsfolk are all quirky bordering on insanity. My aunt had to hold Mia’s good hand while she was being grafted. Then that madwoman remembered after she put the arm in that she had anesthetic.”

"That's how she always looks. She drinks so much that she is permanently drunk. She can go days without beer and still be completely smashed. And her belly? That's full of beer. Her body no longer digests alchohol. It just sits in her gut and accumilates. It never spoils and she can't get it out." Knaoa explains.

"Huh. How come I've never seen her before?" You ask.

"She usually only comes to the bar or grill. She never goes swimming."

"I see." You walk over to Elena, who just sat down at the monster table.

"Hello," You call up to her. "I'm Stephen."

Elena looks at you. Knaoa was right. She looks hammered.

"Hey there. I.. don't think I've met you. My namsh's... (hic) Elena. Howah you doin'?" She says, or tries to say. Her speech was completely slurred.

"Fine. Um, you seem like you've had way too much to drink." You tell her.

"Too much? I havn' had a glash o' beer in free daysh." She slurrs. "Ah's permanently (hic) drunk. But ah don' mahnd. Gave me mah precious guht heer." She pats her massive belly for emphasis. you can hear the beer sloshing in her.

"I see." You reply. This woman was a problem to talk with. You could barely understand her.

"Heyh. Ah'm heeding down to deh beech. Thersh a new lifegard dere. A shuucuubus. Has dat... LOS thing. I wanna (hic) meet heer. Wanna join meh?"

She must be refering to Lascivite Jedore. She started at the beach recently. Do you take her up on her offer?
144322.title: The Walking Beer Keg

144323.content:
The footsteps got even heavier as they got closer... they were heavier than any you had felt before.
When you turned your head to see who or what it was you see...
144323.title: Something Else

1443231.content:
You see her, the biggest monster you had ever seen in your entire life, a were-orca.
She walks over and orders a ton of food (burgers, hotdogs... etc.) when it happened...
... Mesa said, "For ordering so much take this complementary chocolate shake." looking back at Mesa, seeing a smirk on her face.
The orca walks over and takes a seat at one of the nearby tables, placing all her food down, and starts.
The sight of this for you was terrifying. The mass being stuffed in and not long after seeing nothing but a small amount of food-paste stuck to the top of her mouth. She stopped eating for a moment, you looking at her in shock thinking, 'is she full...' when it was the worst possible situation...
...she needed something to wash all the food down with reaching over and grabbing the shake you were stuck in and...

choices: Mesa's gonna drink the shake herself! You're a snack!
She's serving it to a monster. (Who?)
14433.content:
Shrugging your worries off, you take another bite of your burger and chew slowly to savor the taste. Damn, Knaoa outdid herself, this is fantastic. You were no expert on cooking, but this burger had some of the best beef you'd tasted in a while--maybe it was Angus? Maybe even prime rib? Oh well, it was good; that was all that mattered.

Between bites, you spare a few looks up at Mesa as she whips up food for other customers. She's as cheerful as ever, though she makes a few quips about eating or serving humans that make you cringe. But it's not like she'd try anything with Roxy right there, right? Right! And Knaoa didn't seem all that scared of the minotuaress anyway, and she was around Mesa all day: that meant a much bigger chance of being her lunch than you, yet Knaoa was just fine. You smile and take another bite, sure you had little to worry about.

*Thunk!* You jump and look up from your meal, finding a small frosted glass on the counter below you, filled with what looked like a chocolate milkshake. Well, "small" by monster standards, anyway. To you, it was easily the size of a house. The ice cream inside looked nice, though...

"Enjoying your lunch, aren't we, little guy?" Mesa asks as she leans in, covering you in her shadow and smiling. "Careful you don't eat too much, you might have to hit the water. And if you get a cramp, you'll get so tough I'll never cook it out of you!" She shakes a spatula at you, almost like a parent would toa little kid.

Though a bit intimidated at seeing her this close, you chuckle at her quip. "That whole thing about getting cramps 'cause you ate before swimming is a myth, Mesa. I'll be fine...and I'm a lifeguard, remember? You snack on me, Roxy would have a new pair of leather boots by tomorrow!"

Roxy smirks and nods at your little quip, but otherwise stays quiet.

Mesa snorts, chuckling. "Got me there, Stephen...though I could just find a way to be sneaky about it. Who knows?" She winks at you, then turns around toward the grill...giving you a very good look at her plump bovine rear. She was wearing a purple bikini, but only for modesty's sake--being a cow-like monster, Mesa wasn't what most would call 'slim'.

You dart your eyes back down, cheeks flushing. Were you really just staring at Mesa's butt? Not the most gentlemanly thing to do.
That, and she'd probably sit on you if she caught you doing that again. It had happened before, with a bahamut-girl wearing a bikini a few sizes too small for her rounded dragon-hippo form. The swim-suit was barely visible on her and when you'd asked her to leave and put something else on, you ended up pinned under her multi-ton, scaly ass for an hour until Roxy happened by and got her off of you. Not one of your favorite days on the job...

You were so caught up in your flashback that you didn't notice Mesa's tail twitch, crack like a whip and slap you across the back...right into the chocolate mlikshake. Shivering from the cold and trying not to sink into the creamy quicksand, you look up to see Mesa's smirking face above you. She winks, then you feel the glass lurch upward--she must have grabbed it. Seconds later, a giant straw stabs into the ice cream next to you...and then you realize that Mesa HADN'T been kidding about "being sneaky".

Damn, and that burger had been so good.

But what would Mesa do with the milkshake...?
14433.title: Her Milkshake Brings All the Boys to Her Gut..

choices: Mesa Decides to Eat Knaoa Next
Your P.O.V. in Mesa's First Stomach
144331.content:
Mesa smirks at you and shows you her teeth as she shakes her breasts. "Mesa," you say as you sink beneath the ice cream. "You would..." Before you finish you're sentence, you sink beneath the ice cream. "You bet." Says the cow giantess right before she fills another cup with strawberry ice cream and sticks a straw into it. She puts the milkshake in front of Roxy who is too busy eating to notice you're missing.

"Here Roxy," says Mesa. "Have one on the house." "Thanks Mesa," says Roxy as she takes the milkshake. "That's rather neighborly of you. These milkshakes are good Mesa, you should have one yourself some time." Mesa lets out a hearty laugh that you hear as an evil laugh. "I intend to." You couldn't believe it. You thought Mesa was your friend, but now she's gonna eat you. Mesa immediately snatches the milkshake you're in and licks her lips.

It looks like she's gonna suck through the straw, but at the last seconds she forcefully takes the straw out of the milkshake and then chugs the entire thing causing the ice cream to flow into her mouth. You try to swim for it to keep from being eaten but the chocolate is too thick and soon you're in Mesa's mouth. "Mesa!" you shout. "Don't eat me!" But you slip onto Mesa's tongue that wraps around you like a snake and then drags you into her mouth before snapping it shut as she wipes the chocolate ice cream off her lips and smirks.

Inside the minotaur's mouth, the tongue moves erratically as you're buffeted by the ice cream and even cough as some of it is forced down your throat. You hear moans of delight coming from Mesa as she pushes you against her flat grinding herbivorous teeth. This was a nightmare come true; being eaten by a giant cow with a mouthful of ice cream. Mesa then decides to end it and holds up her head. You try to grab hold of her tongue but some of the ice cream falls down on you, covering your head and causing you to slip down into Mesa's throat where the minotaur giantess swallows you.

The next thing you knew, you were in one of Mesa's four stomachs in a mountain of ice cream. Under the mountain that is. You gag and expect to die, but somehow, the digestive juices don't hurt you. Then you remember, you won't be digested for real until you're in the last stomach. You burst out of the ice cream and climb to the top as you shiver and look around. You were in pure horror. Mesa ate you.

Outside, the cow woman smiles and rubs her bloated stomach as milk drips from her udder at how exquisite your flavor was. At that moment, Knaoa walks along the table and looks around before running so Mesa could see her. "Mesa," she asks. "Where's Stephen?" Mesa then gives an evil smile and glare Knaoa's way, scaring the heck out of Knaoa as the minotaur giantess taps her stomach.
144331.title: Trapped in the Belly of the Cow

1443311.content:
“Hmm hmm good! Having that for a snack was great! I think I will have another one right now, and thankfully there is another one right there.” Mesa said with an evil smile just as she rubs her stomach and looks at Knaoa, who is now really scared, but still wants to get her boss to come to her senses somehow. “Uh Mesa, are you alright?” Knaoa asked as if she was a scared girl. She is hoping that her boss doesn’t eat her at all, after all bot she and Mesa are good friends despite some hiccups, and she is just praying to god that she doesn’t have the same fate as Stephen. “I am fine my friend. I am just going to have you as a snack if you don’t mind, my snack was so good I just want to have another one right here and now.” Mesa said evilly just as she now picks up the scared girl and brings her to her wide open mouth. Just before she eats her, Mesa takes one good lick on Knaoa to make sure it was edible, and then her eyes just jolt right open. “Now that hits the spot.” Mesa said evilly just as she now throws the girl in her mouth, but Knaoa manages to grab and hang on to the tongue. Mesa then begins to shake her tongue in order to get Knaoa to lose her grip and let go. Eventually that does end up happening to Knaoa, and she slips all the way down in her throat, through the esophagus like a roller coaster slide, and eventually she hits face first in the ice cream that Stephen hit.

Right back outside, Mesa was done having her snack and had a good feeling in her stomach that her food will be digesting soon. That shake was really good to her. “Man, that shake was just delicious.” Mesa smiled just as Roxy comes back after finishing her shake. “I must admit, that was really really good.” Roxy told her. “I got to get back to work right now, thanks for the shake.” she smiled. “You are welcome.” Mesa said just before she goes back to work, she comes back to notice that something is off. “Where’s Knaoa?” Mesa wondered. She look at her station for a few moments and around and then came to thinking this. “I think she is right now taking a break. After all, sometimes all that work that I put her through tends to exhaust her; and no kidding.” She said before she got back to work.

/

In The First Stomach

What a day so far? You were doing your usual job as a lifeguard, and then you went to get some lunch from Mesa and Knaoa, and by a big turn of events, you ended up in a shake, and Mesa ends up eating you. You thought you were going to die, but you actually managed to survive as there was no acid. You were though having a pretty bad cold. All that cold ice cream has surely given you a headache, not to mention you ate some of it all in one time, giving you a brain freeze. After a bit your headache seems to go away, however what happened next was a bit of a surprise. You heard a scream that is that of a girl coming down and you look up to see Knaoa falling right into the same ice cream as you. Thankfully the fall wasn’t bad, and so was your fall pleasant. You run up to Knaoa to check if she is alright. “Knaoa, are you alright?” you shouted to her. Knaoa woke up and notice you. “Stephen? You are here to.” Knaoa said just as she comes and hugs him. You hug her to make sure that she is not scared at all. “Yep, somehow I got into the shake and I was swallowed by Mesa, what was she thinking?”

“Yeah. I didn’t notice you when I was cooking your meal. I got done with it and then I went up to check on Mesa, and then she looked somewhat evil right then and then she picked me up and then she gave me a lick, thought I was tasty, and then she throws me into her mouth, and I tried to hang on to her tongue but eventually I gave way and I fell right into an ice cream.” Knaoa said in a hyper panicking way as if she was going to have a heart attack, but then you hugged her again. “It’s going to be okay. There is no acid in here so we are fine.” You told her in a concern and father like way.

“That is true, but Mesa has four stomachs, and we have got to out of here, but hopefully not get to her fourth stomach, as that is where all the digesting will begin. I learned that at Monster High School.” Knaoa told you as she had some knowledge on minotaurs and how they have 4 stomachs. “I moved here when I was a child.”

“That is interesting thing to here, but right now we have got to find a way out of here before we become digested by Mesa. Is there anything we can do? There is surely no way we are going to climb back up through her mouth as we will more likely be falling from there if we try to, and secondly and most importantly, if we go into her fourth stomach, we are surely going to die, so is there an idea that you have that can get us out of here, as I don’t want to die.” You asked her as she knows minotaurs a bit, and she started to ponder about it for a moment before she was able to think of something in her head.

“I know an idea.” Knaoa told you. “What is it?” you asked her. “Well, I am going to be honest though, you are not going to like it. We are going to have to be ready when we get to the fourth stomach, and perhaps if we use the food items around here correctly, we could end up getting through the other parts of her body, and perhaps we can try to escape through her ears.” Knaoa asked.

What happens now?
1443311.title: Mesa Decides to Eat Knaoa Next

1443321.content:
Mesa takes the chocolate shake and puts it in front of Roxy who is finishing her meal. "How about a nice chocolate shake on the house Roxy? This one has a lot of zing to it." "Thanks Mesa." Says Roxy as she takes the shake. As you're shivering in the ice cream, you're in complete horror at what you hear. Mesa was going to trick Roxy into eating you! "Rox...!" you shout but you sink underneath the chocolate before you can finish your sentence.

As Roxy is about to take a sip, Knaoa realizes what happened and gasps. Mesa turns her head and both glares and smirks at her assistant at the same time. "Say one word to Roxy," the minotaur whispers under her breath. "And you're next." Knaoa backs off as Mesa grins at her. Meanwhile, in your frosty prison you feel yourself being pulled through a current and you're scream if you weren't muffled by chocolate ice cream. You feel yourself going up a large tube and realize to your horror that Roxy is drinking the shake and you with it. You try to swim down but it's no use. Lifeguard or no lifeguard, there was no way you could swim through thick ice cream. You are sucked right into Roxy's mouth in a pile of frozen chocolate and look around to see your gargoyle friend's fangs. Roxy's tongue moves around and you're rocked about as you try to keep from getting eaten.

Outside Roxy makes a strange face. "What is that weird taste?" she thinks to herself. "Maybe the last time Mesa milked herself she forgot to pasteurize it." You start to sink as the mouth fills up with shake and you're slipping down Roxy's throat. It was one of your worst nightmares come true. Being a gargoyle, Roxy would never think about eating humans even if she was a big fatty. But now she was unknowingly going to devour you. "Roxy!" you shout. "Whatever you do! Don't swallow!"

145.content:
You approached the hydra woman just as she was beginning to head into the water, her diving gear all ready and her wetsuit sleek against her tight form.

"Hey, Laura!" You shout up, tapping against her scaly foot to get her attention. All four of her heads perked to the side in curiosity before realizing the source of origin calling her name was coming from below. She looked down to see you standing beside her.

"Oh," One head said. "Hello there," Another went on. "Stephen. How are you," The third head continued. "This fine day?" The last finished the sentence. You would really have to get used to that.

"Fine, just checking up on the beachgoers. How about yourself?"

"I'm fine,"

"Just about to-"

"Go for a swim. Would you-"

"Like to join me?"

"Depends." You shrugged. "Where you diving to?"
145.title: Laura, the hydra diver

1451.content:
"I" "am" "actually" "visiting" "a relative" "of mine" "underwater." Says all four of Laura's heads in location. "It is." "Precisely why." "I moved to." "Terrordale in. "the" "first place." "she lives in." "An underwater." "Cave."

Huh. You didn't even know that hydras were aquatic monsters. If so, why would Laura need a wetsuit and scuba gear. It didn't really make much... Wait a minute, Laura is a hydra! All hydras (including the original hydra) are descended from Echidna. This might not be a hydra if it was a descendent of the mother of all monsters.

"Uh, sure, I'd like to accompany you." Laura picks you up and starts walking towards the water. While it was against your better judgement, you were really curious as to what kind of monster Laura's relative was. Laura placed you on top of her third head before she tossed you up a miniature diving suit of your own. You quickly put your suit on as the giant hydra slowly descends in the water and lowers all four of her heads. The four headed dragoness dives down and swims past an enormous coral reef that from the looks of it, could easily pass for a human city if it wasn't completely submerged under the water.

Laura continues to swim and you pass several unusual looking fish including one fish that looked like it had an axe handle shaped fin, a shark with the head and skin of a crocodile and even a fish that looked like a dilapidated monkey with six legs. The fauna of the monster world was extremely mysterious but under water there were creatures that could barely be identified as any kind of animal. You hide between Laura's hair and shiver. You thought you saw a few mermaids and given that the mermaid you knew thought of you only as food, you were cautious.

It isn't long before Laura comes to an underwater cave. As she surfaces you see that the interior isn't all water and has breathable air. There are glowing bubbles in the walls as decorations and the entire cave was decorated with rainbow color. As Laura surfaced you saw a shadow. Presumably her relative.

Then the figure walks out and you see that this relative was in fact..."
1451.title: Underwater Relative

choices: A cave you had never seen
1452.content:
"I found something interesting-"

"In the nearby reef. Would you-"

"Care to join-"

"Me?"

To be honest, what Laura just said did sound interesting. If there was something near the reef you, as a lifeguard, should know about it in case it was dangerous. So you decided to tag along with Laura.

"Alright, I'll come with you." You tell her.

All four of her heads smiled, before she picked you up and placed you inside one of her scuba masks, presumably so you don't get lost. At that, she went into the water and started swimming for the reef.

From your place in her mask, you could see everything in the water. As frightening as the beach can be at times, the ocean was truly beautiful. There were so many species of plants and fish to see of all sizes, monster and human. The only thing you dreaded about the ocean was Paisley, and you didn't know where she was today.

Eventually, you reach the reef. Laura speaks up to let you know.

"We're at the-"

"Reef. To the left-

"Is the thing is was-"

"Talking about."

Looking to the left, you did see what she was talking about. It was...
1452.title: An Interesting Find

14522.content:
In front of Stephen and Laura was one of the biggest submarines they had ever seen. It could easily fit a monster around 800 feet. It had a simple, old-time design, but it looked like it had been repaired several times.

Stephen was amazed. He had never seen a submarine in real life before. He couldn't tell if it was abandoned or not. Laura pulled him from his train of thought.

"There an open hatch-"

"On the submarines-"

"Top. Let's go in-"

"And check it out."

Before Stephen could answer, Laura was already on her way to the sub. They reached the open hatch and climbed in. Closing the hatch above them, the water suddenly drained. Laura took Stephen out of her mask and put her on her shoulder, then entered the sub proper.

The inside was nothing like the out. The hall they were in was narrow, but it was furnished like the inside of a home, with desks nailed to the floor and pictures on the hull.

"You think someone lives here?" You ask Laura, confused. Before she could answer, you heard a voice.

"WHO THE F**K ARE YOU?!"

Turning around, both you and Laura faced a woman with a harpoon gun pointed at you. The woman was a Oni, around 725 feet with orange skin, red eyes, and short black hair. She had a set of small horns on top of her head. This woman was incedibly fat, to the point of almost bursting out of her black, one-piece bikini. She did not look happy at your intrusion.

"I SAID WHO ARE YOU AND WHY ARE YOU IN KAREN?!"

Karen must have been the name of the sub. You decided to answer.

"My name is Stephen and this is Laura. We saw you subma- I mean Karen near the reef. The hatch on top was open. We thought Karen was abandoned, so we came in."

While she still looked mad, she at least lowered her harpoon gun. The hull of the submarine started creaking. Suddenly, the woman started touching the wall.

"Shh, don't worry Karen. I'm dealing with these two. I'm sure they'll leave soon enough." She said while stroking the wall.

This woman was cleary crazy. You cleared your throat.

"Um, do you mind introducing yourself?" You ask.

"My name is Aquell." The oni replied, still stroking the wall.

You didn't want Aquell to point her harpoon gun at you again, so you asked a simple question.

"Do you mind showing us around Karen?"

Aquell stopped stroking the wall and looked at you. How did she react to your question?
14522.title: Meeting the Insane Oni

choices: Before you can do anything, Laura takes you

You then understood what the message meant then. It seems like the hydra girl is going to go look at some underwater tunnels that she has found underwater. Get it, underwater that was found underwater, pretty clever ain't I. However, sadly for you, you had to get on your way as you have a bit of a great meeting for Fran, and heck' Chihiro wants to spend some of the day with you, so you had to get going, and you are sad you aren't going to be able to visit the tunnels with Laura.

'Sorry to disappoint, but I got plans for the day, so I really have to get going.' You told them, and Laura understands this right afterwards.

'We understand.' The first head said. 'that you are busy.' The second one said. 'at this very'' the third head said before the 4th one finished. 'moment.' 'Well, it's nice to see you.' You replied to them before you get going and on your way to'?

15.content:
Suddenly you hear a pounding on the wall near your fire cabinet house and let out a grunt. "What was that?" you ask. Then you walk up and see a familiar titanic yellow face in front of you. It's your partner, Roxy, the gargoyle and as she opens the door, you walk out into her giant clawed hand. "Stephen," she says. "I know it's early, but we've got a situation. One of the psychos from the mental hospital got loose again." "You're kidding me," you say as Roxy puts you on her shoulder. "Who's the idiot who built an asylum near a public beach in the first place?" Roxy lets out a sigh. "That's our tax money at work," she says sarcastically. "I'm beginning to think that Terrordale is like... what did you call it... Springfield?"

Soon, you and Roxy are flying overhead looking for the psychotic fiend that broke out of the mental hospital. "So what's going on?" you ask. "I don't know," says Roxy. "They didn't tell me who it was. But I have a gut feeling that it's one of our five regulars." "You oughta work on that gut Roxy," you say. "I'm surprised you can still fly." Roxy glares at you for that crack at her weight. "You want to take a swim pipsqueak?"

You shut up. Roxy was friendly, but she didn't like having her weight pointed out. "Uh-oh," says Roxy. "There she is." You look down to see the monster causing trouble was...

151.content:
As you both look down, you immediately notice several beach goers tangled in spider webs. "Oh no," you groan. "It's Natasha." "Great." Groans Roxy. Natasha was a black widow drider giantess who's mental disorder was that she thought she was a pirate in the 17th century. She was easy to spot with her bright red hair, her large red backed abdomen and her tricorne hat with a jolly roger of a spider.

She was one of the more aggressive patients at the Kaiju Disarming Plant and was infamous for attacking people at the beach. Roxy swoops down to a tangled up werefox and tanuki couple and cuts them free with her claws. "Did either of you see where that drider made off to?" The male tanuki stands up and helps his werefox girlfriend back on her feet before answering. "She went off to the East of the beach. Dag nab it, what were they thinking building the K.D.P. on a public beach?" "Thanks." Roxy says. Roxy flies up to search for Natasha and then hears a sinister cackling and muffled screams.

"Oh no!" you and Roxy both yell at once. As you both fly forward you realize that Natasha is causing trouble....

152.content:
"It's Jen," you say. "She just flew by." Roxy let out a grunt and grit her fangs. "Not that idiot again." Jen was an unusual type of monster known as a haniver. She resembled a blue skinned fish like woman with large wings of a manta ray attached to her arms that allowed her to fly She had gills on her neck to breath under water, white spots over her blue body and a manta's stinger for a tail. Jen was one of the more troublesome of the escapees.

The stingray woman's backstory is a tragic one. She was walking home from a movie about a megalomaniac mad scientist named Dr. Saturday but before she could reach home, she passed a condemned building just as it was being destroyed and some heavy debris hit her on the head and nearly killed her. Unfortunately the impact left her with brain damage that made her believe that she was Dr. Saturday herself and as such she has sworn to take over Terrordale. Since her family admitted her to the asylum, she's been trying to take over the town starting with the beach.

Jen was a nuisance because she was good at building weapons and tools that actually worked. Also being a haniver, she could fly through the sky and swim underwater like a torpedo. She wasn't the most dangerous of the psychos but she was the hardest one to catch.

"We've got to find her before she tears Gravefield Beach to the ground." Says Roxy. Roxy flaps her wings to try and find Jen before she causes any trouble and you look around for any sign of Jen. Where do you find that delusional stingray woman?"

“Oh my God, what in the name of the gates of hell is going on with Mesa?” You said completely in shock as that strange delusional Jen girl now has Mesa as her hostage, and along with her human partner out of the picture for now as she was doing something else, and you knew that you had to do something right before Jen can do something bad to Mesa. Mesa is the only cook around the Shores, so it would be pretty bad to go without food for weeks if she was killed.
